  8. The soap and the mug is great, I will give a five star for that. The brush is below average and keeps on shedding the bristles and its a mess to clean the puck of shed bristles, even after a few months of use. The stand also is the same, its wobbly and cheap. Basically you are paying the price for just the soap and mug.
  9. This is probably one of the best if not THE best starter set out there for anyone wanting to get into using a double edged safety razor and brush. I bought this a couple years ago when I first started, and still use the brush, cup, and stand still. First the brush is 100% badger! It is hard to even find a 100% badger brush for the price of this kit. A number of them start at double what this kit costs. So you can almost think of it as just getting the cup, soap, and stand for free! I've read that some people have had issues with the brush falling apart, but I've had mine for two years and not had those issues.
  10. I got this set as a gift so just the thought of it was nice but overall I'm pretty disappointed in the quality of the brush and stand. The brush, like all brushes, lost a few bristles early on and that was expected. Then for the next few months it was fine until this morning. A large clump of bristles just fell out of the center of the brush. Mind you, I've only had about 4 months use out of it. It might last for a few more months but I'll be replacing it soon enough.<br />The acrylic stand was a letdown. Cheap plastic and the shape of the stand makes it pretty precarious when only the razor is resting on it.<br />The soap had a very distinct aroma that smelled more like a discount bar soap. That got put aside after only a couple uses.<br />As I mentioned in the headline, the shaving cup is really nice, so at least it's not a total loss.
  11. Great set for the money. Wish the lather or soap was better but other than that, the brush and stand and cup are a bargin. I would buy this again.
  12. I purchased this set to start wet shaving with a safety razor and it is great. I was worried about wet shaving in general because I have sensitive skin and my neck breaks out when I shave. I have tried everything from high priced electric razors to disposables 1-5 blades, with no relief from red bumps, itchy skin and ingrown hairs. Let me tell you I have never, never had a better shave than the one I get with my safety razor. I hated shaving for all the reasons above and therefore would only do it 2-3 times a week. In a professional environment I felt like I came across lazy if I didn't shave all the time. Not only do I love to shave now but I look forward to it and even do it on the weekends when I am not going into the office.<br /><br />After shopping around for the pieces individually I came across this set. Price is unbeatable for what you get. The mug is solid and fits in my hand well. The stand is functional and functions well my DE razor fits securely. The brush holds a good amount of water and builds up a good lather. I have been using the brush daily for over 2 The shave soap is<br /><br />I am sure there are better items out there but this set is 100% useable and was inexpensive enough to allow me to feel comfortable to try it out. I am satisfied with this set so much that I don't think I will even purchase other item to try and find better ones.
  13. Nice set - unfortunately the shaving brush came apart from its handle after just a few uses.
  14. I got tired of shelling out $ for replacement blades so I opted for a straight razor and figured I'd try this old school shave set to round it all out. I had no interest in buying a set for $100 so I chose this based on the details and reviews. The set looks very nice and even came with a pill of soap. At first my lather was very sudsy and not very thick but I realized that if you use less water it fixes the issue so the soap itself seems to be fine. The brush is natural hair which supposedly holds water better which would make sense since it is more porous than synthetic material. The downside is that the brush had a musky odor for a while but over time it's seemed to mellow out. It was quite pungent at first though. The razor/brush holder is just molded plastic with a blocky type form that is quite pointy and edged which is don't much care for but until I get a better one this will do. Ultimately for the price I am happy with this product. The only other thing I would complain about though is that the product name sounds German but the bowl had a sticker that said made in china so that was a bit disappointing. Otherwise, it's all good.

  44. Having just started wet shaving, this was the perfect start up set for me. It comes with everything you need to start minus the razor and blades. I have seen other reviews bashing the quality of the brush or saying the mug was awkward, and I must say I haven't had those negative experiences. The mug fits well into my hand and is easy to hold and the brush is the lowest quality of badger brushes, so I wouldn't expect to much. I've lost a couple hairs from the brush here and there, but nothing that would make me think any less of the product.<br /><br />The only reason I gave it 4 out of 5 stars is because the stand could be a little wider so the brush and double edged razor would both fit better. You can still put hang both on the stand with no problem, but one of them will not be placed in their spot all the way.
  45. Pluses: -The brush stand holds a razor as well -The soap is surprisingly nice. Very mild and very easy to lather. -The bowl is easy to use with any type of soap and is a nice, heavy, ceramic bowl -Badger brush feels great and lathers well with any type of soap Minuses: -The badger brush lost a bit of hair in the beginning, but I think this is pretty normal. Since the first use, I have noticed significant hair loss from the brush, just the occasional bristle here and there. Lather: The lather was very easy to work up. By adding water incrementally to the bowl with the brush, and working the brush in a circular motion in the bowl, I was able to build up a nice lather on the brush. The brush then washes really easily--it really is more like hair than I thought it would be. The soap that comes in the set doesn't have much (if any) fragrance, and is super mild. Brush: The brush is great. Before the first time I used it, I shampooed it as I had read about somewhere with the shampoo I regularly use. Don't know if this made any difference but it was easy to do. I tend to rinse the brush thoroughly in warm water before I use it, and flick any excess water out. If I need additional water to get a good lather, I just put water in the soap bowl or rinse the brush a bit more. I hesitate from using super hot water because I'm not sure what it would do to the bristles. Shave prep: I just take a hot shower and use a mild face cleanser. I don't use any pre-shave oil, and I use a plain moisturizer instead of an aftershave.
  46. This is a great set for a great price. The brush is a dream to use. I couldn't be more pleased.
  47. The razor and brush stand feels/looks very fragile, but did not have any issues with it. I love the mug, have no problem holding it or what so ever. would recommend this to someone who wants to start wet shaving. Paired this shaving set with a Parker 96r razor, and i have been having a great shave for the past month.
  48. Received as gift. Love it. The mug is sturdy and soap is better than previous shaving cream I used. I enjoy lathering up with the badger. Only con, is that it seems to lose quite a few badger hairs after each shave. I would expect a hair falling out every one-and-a-while, but every shave it loses a couple of hairs.
  49. I've had enough of the poor quality and overpriced disposable blades (e.g. Mach 3) and was initially set on just upgrading my cordless electric shaver. However, when I really thought about it, I've always preferred the feel and result of a good shave with a razor blade, so I decided to go old school and try out a double-edged razor. I decided on this kit both because of the good reviews and I simply like the style.<br /><br />The mug is very cool and looks good on the bathroom counter. Out of the box, the logo on the badger hair brush was partially scraped off (or poorly applied), so I questioned the quality a bit there, but it wasn't bad enough to warrant an exchange, plus the quality of the brush overall seemed fine. After only three uses, the badger \\"stink\\" seems to be gone already.<br /><br />I liked the fact that the included soap was hypo-allergenic. For my first time using a brush to work up a lather from this kind of soap, it seemed to lather up fine and the fragrance is very, very mild. The brush and razor stand with it's clear plastic (or perhaps acrylic) complements the brush and my black-handled Edwin Jagger razor nicely, but it definitely could be a bit sturdier when racking the brush handle (a tad wobbly).<br /><br />I would certainly recommend this kit and would say it's fairly priced. I look forward to trying a different soap when the included one is used up and perhaps upgrading the stand, too.<br /><br />***Brush rinsing tip***<br />So, you're supposed to rinse out all the soap and dry the brush as best as you can when you're done, so here's what I found to be the most efficient way:<br />-Start by gently shaking and rotating the brush under fairly high faucet pressure.<br />-Splay out the brush against the palm of your hand to increase the amount of bristles exposed to the water. Don't spread them by pulling the bristles apart with your fingers.<br />-The brush should be thoroughly soaked at this point. Immediately hold the brush upright(bristles on top) to prevent the water from dripping on your floor and go to your shower and vigorously shake the water out. Should only take a few shakes till the bristles look fairly dry and you don't see any soap gathered at the tip. Doing this in the shower will save you from the splatter mess that would otherwise occur on your bathroom counter and mirror (as I found out the first time).
  50. My guy was using the art of shaving miniature set and he was complaining about the tiny size of the brush so I got him this for Christmas and he loves it. Not only is the brush much bigger it works a lot better. He loves the soap which was a little confusing at first but a quick YouTube search showed us he was using it wrong. (You aren't supposed to put the soap in the bowl, the bowl is for spinning the brush to lather. Leave the soap in its packaging.) only issue he has is his Gillette Fusion with the Flex Ball doesn't really fit in there but he just wrapped one of my hair scrunchies on there and it stays put. All in all this was an excellent purchase that competes with and demolishes the competition in price and quality.

  61. Well after shaving with a safety razor for 2 months, i decided to edit my review. This set is extremely good for the price. The brush is very nice and it is holding up very well. It shed some hairs in the beginning but it does not lose any now. I really like the soap and prefer it over the Proraso Menthol Shaving Cream, which i'm sure you probably heard of already if you are researching DE shaving. You will definitely save a lot of money buy buying this instead of buying parts individually. However, in the future you can easily upgrade and spoil yourself with a $100 brush or what not if you are shaving with a safety razor and saving all this money by not buying<br />cartridges for that horrible and expensive Gillete Fusion. A pack of 100 Derby blades will last you a year.
  62. Great set for those starting out with wet shaving. It has everything you need to start - the brush is a pretty good badger brush, the soap is very good (smells great), and the apothocary mug is very nice looking and easy to use. The stand for the brush is a little chintzy but it's pretty sturdy plastic with a slot for your razor (wish it matched the brush and mug). It is well worth the price and a great way to start.
  63. A Badger brush, very nice shaving soap, a mug that fits easily in the hand, and an attractive and sturdy clear plastic brush and razor stand make this a great value. The packaging was very protective.
  64. Good starter kit. The brush does shed a bit, but for me that's not a big deal. I did not receive the stand in my package, but contact Amazon and they offered 20% off.
  65. I originally bought this for my brother as a Christmas gift. He was new to wet shaving so I figured this would be a great addition to the Merkur razor I gave him. I thought the set looked great so I bought one for myself. The soap smells great and lathers up really well. The stand looks great which is a plus since it's out in the open in my bathroom. However, the brush has poor quality as it loses bristles every shave. Most brushes will lose bristles for the first few shaves but this one lost bristles every shave for months. I switched back to my Tweezerman brush and found I was also getting a better lather.
  66. This set is great. If you're taking the plunge into strait razor or safety razor shaving or even if you still use you cartridge razor, this set is sure to add comfort and class to your daily (or weekly, nobody's judging you) shave. I don't have anything to compare the entire set to, but I can say I quite enjoy it and that I have no buyers remorse. The brush is extremely soft, and only about 5 hairs fell out during the initial break-in period (about 1-2 weeks), which I hear is normal for most brushes. The soap lathers extremely well and has a very pleasant smell that strongly reminds me of my body wash and deodorant, which is good because I love the smell of my body wash and deodorant (Dove for Men: Clean Comfort, for those wondering). The mug holds the soap; that's about it, but it does so in class. The stand is a simple solution and does its job extremely well. The stand is acrylic, which guarantees it won't rust. Overall this set is an awesome value, and the soap is easily replaced if you don't like it. Pros: -Excellent value for both experts and beginners -All components are of high quality Cons: -The only con I could really think of would be that, this set won't quite do it for those shaving snobs
  67. The pictures you see of this product on Amazon doesn't do justice to the quality of this set. It exudes luxury for a fraction of the price you'd pay to get some sets from top brands like Truefitt & Hill. I'm very pleased with this set. The badger brush is adequate. Not the best, but it does what it's created for: to create lather. It's also extremely soft and builds a good lather if you use proper technique. Please build lather by using it like the way you'd paint, stroking back and forth with your shave cream or soap. Also, the accompanying mug is quite nice. Normally, you'd expect to pay the price you'd pay for this set just to obtain a quality mug like this. It's got an old school feel to it, and it feels good in the hands, and is well crafted. The stand that comes with this set isn't made of chrome or stainless steel, but it really does go well with this set. Finally, if you have a shave cream or soap that you like, this may not live up to it. However, this is a solid soap, and it smells fresh and clean. Can't say that about a lot of soaps these days. All in all, a fantastic set for those who want the best on a budget.
  68. I like mine very much, works good for a beginner and the soap makes a nice thick lather. However you can get this at WalMart for 24 dollars
  69. The soap is great! Takes a bit more to lather it than other soaps do, but overall it's great for a beginners set. The brush lathers up pretty well, but it does shed quite a bit. Stand is a little flimsy and my razor (EJ89) doesn't like to stay in it very well. I'll be looking for a new stand soon.

  71. I decided to get back into wet shaving with a DE Safety razor.. Saw this set for a good price and bought it.. The mug is really nice.. A good weight to it.. The brush I got with the set was shedding 3-4 hairs each shave for the first week, which I thought was normal.. Then it started shedding 10-15 hairs each shave (which is NOT normal).. I contacted VDH, and they sent me a new brush!! Now that's great customer service! I've had the new one for almost a month, and besides a couple at the beginning, has not shed any hairs! Wonderful brush! Gets really soft in a week or so. The stand is nothing to write home about, but it does its job. I have not used the shave soap (I prefer creams).. My wife somehow broke the mug a week ago, and I've been using a fruit bowl.. Just not the same.. When I saw a price drop on the set, I just ordered another one!! Mainly to get the mug, but now, I'll also have a backup brush... Maybe this time, I'll try the soap.. :)

  75. If you are new to wet shaving, this is a great starter set. However, if you decide you like wet shaving, you may want to replace a few items. The brush is a decent brush, but will shed more and longer than higher grade brushes. Also, shaving &#34;soaps&#34; as opposed to &#34;creams&#34; are harder to work with in general. Soaps require a pretty specific water content, so if you are having trouble getting used to wet shaving, before you give up try a cream rather than a soap.
  76. Purchased this along with a Parker DE 22R safety Razor. The mug is solid and feels nice in my hand, the brush seems to be of high quality and the stands does what it is designed to do. I really like the smell of the soap as well as how much it can lather up, quite impressive how little is used each time. I read alot of reviews commenting on how the brush seemed to shed alot, I did not experience this issue so much. Now I've only used it three times so far but have lost a total of maybe 3 or 4 bristles. I have been fairly vigorous with the lathering process wanting to produce as much rich lather as I can becuase I shave my whole head. I would definately recommend this to anyone interested in trying out wet shaving.

  78. Great starter set for the money. I bought this when I first got into shaving with a double edge safety razor back in 2012. I still use it.<br /><br />The brush/razor holder works fine.<br />The ceramic mug retains heat from hot water fairly well, keeping the lather inside it warm.<br />The luxury shave soap has a nice scent and lathers well.<br />At first, the brush would lose hairs, but after getting past the brush's break-in point, loose hairs are less common.<br /><br />I can't compare the brush to higher end brushes, as I can't bring myself to spend hundreds of dollars on a silvertip badger brush. I can compare it to the synthetic brush from The Body Shop. This brush is more bulbous and I feel it creates and holds lather better. I use the synthetic Body Shop brush more for travel.

I would definitely recommend this product to anyone not wanting to spend a fortune on the chrome sets.

  85. First, this is a handy kit. The cup and the stand are perfect for me. The shaving soap is wonderful on my incredibly sensitive skin too. Anyways, my only complaint is the brush. I've had it for about two months and the bristles are starting to fall out. I'm not doing anything odd or improper with the brush, so I'm not sure what's wrong. I'll probably get a better brush after the new year and put up with the thing for now. I would say find another brush if you get this pack.
  86. I have been shaving since the Navy forced me to do that daily in boot camp in March 1964. I prefer using a blade and Gillette with its constantly changing blade count has provided me with the necessary instrument to remove the excess hair. When younger I tried foam from an aerosol can as softener, but settled on soap from a bar rubbed between my hands for that medium. That worked for about 35 years, but I was interested by using a brush and soap dish and this was the first offering of that combination which was inexpensive enough to get my attention. I like it. I like the handle on the soap dish, I like the stand for the brush between usages, I like the foam that the soap provides and I have been getting excellent results. Great product and great value.

  90. This is a good set to buy if you're thinking about getting into wet shaving, or if you just want to enjoy your shaving experience a little more, but there are some things to be desired in this set. My absolute favorite part of this set is the soap. The soap produces a good lather and it is extremely gentle on the skin. On top of that, I absolutely love the smell of this soap. I like the soap so much that I will definitely be buying refills in the future. The second best part of this set is the soap mug. It's a nice ceramic mug that looks sharp and provides a great way to load up your shaving brush. I will continue to use this mug for a long time. The stand that comes in the set is serviceable, but it doesn't hold a safety razor particularly well, and it's just cheap looking plastic. For the most part, the stand does it's job, but I'm sure that I'll be upgrading someday. My least favorite part of this set is the brush. This was my first shaving brush, so I at least appreciate it for the simple fact that it introduced me to wet shaving and opened my eyes to the reality that shaving can and should be a more enjoyable experience. The experience of brushing a nice smelling lather on your face with a soft brush is pretty cool if you've never done it before. However, the brush itself just isn't that great. I was getting frustrated with not being able to build a good lather with this set and thought it was either my own poor technique or a problem with the soap. I spent $17 to get a decent boar brush, and the improvement was immediate and profound. The first time I used my new brush with this soap I built a thick, meringue-like lather. When compared to my new brush, I've realized that this Van Der Hagen brush is just plain cheap. The bristles aren't that soft and they just don't produce a great lather. Even my $17 boar brush completely blew this Van Der Hagen brush away.<br /><br />I would say this kit isn't bad if you're looking to get into wet shaving,or if you just want to try shaving with soap and a brush, but if you're serious about getting into this style of shaving I would recommend getting a different brush. The set is worth it for the stand, mug, and soap, I think, but the brush is underwhelming.

  100. For traditional shaving, this set has all you need to get your technique down. Then, perhaps, you can move on to other products, or not, if you like it. It is a good value and a better than VDH's Deluxe set -- which is has a bowl, glycerin soap and a boar brush, rather than badger.<br /><br />The soap is pleasant and requires about 45 seconds of swirling to load the brush. You can then face lather or whip it up in an additional bowl, whatever your preference. The soap smell is nice, subtle and masculine.<br /><br />The brush is quite good for the price. Obviously, not as dense as a silvertip at $150, but it does the job with a reasonable amount of backbone.<br /><br />The mug is an apothecary style and does what it does, either for lathering on the puck or transferring to a bowl after loading the brush. It's an attractive style, used by many other makers.<br /><br />The stand is the weak part, but not enough to downgrade the set. I don't mind the plastic and the brush section holds the brush well, but the razor section is a little weak and assumes either an extra long razor handle or a straight razor, the latter of which is not the likely purchaser of this set. But it will hold the VDH razor well, dangling, if the TTO doors are OPEN to dry as this razor has a narrower head than an EJ89, Merkur 34c, etc. It holds these brands as well, dangling.<br /><br />The stand is likely designed to please everyone, so it doesn't master one. It's designed to hold a DE hanging... and the bottom divot is for water drips. For a razor to lean in the slot, resting in the divot requires a handle 120mm long! Most DE handles are 75mm (short) to 100mm (XL) long. Traditional is about 80-85mm.<br /><br />I would buy this set for a family member or friend looking into trying traditional DE shaving without hesitation, knowing they will likely move on in a few months. It's a good value. (The VDH razor is forgiving and not bad either, but that's another review.)
  101. Recently I decided to go old-school with my shaving habits. I'd read about the benefits of using shaving soap and a badger hair brush as part of a morning routine, so I took to Amazon to research my options. After looking through items by The Art of Shaving, I'd started thinking the price point on this sort of thing might be out of my ballpark if I wanted quality. Then I stumbled across Van Der Hagen. I've been using my Van Der Hagen shave set for 2-3 weeks now, and my only regret is that I didn't try this years ago! My mornings are honestly more energized since I added this to my routine. I used to hate shaving; now I actually look forward to it! It has without a doubt become one of my favorite simple pleasures. And the aesthetic of my apothecary cup filled with shaving soap, and my brush in it's stand...it just makes the bathroom counter feel more luxurious. When I need a refill on my shaving soap, or a new badger hair brush, I will definitely be a return Van Der Hagen customer.
  102. This is a great set to give double edge or straight razor shaving a try. I like the brush, and while i am sure for more money i can get better, this was a great way to try it without breaking the bank.<br /><br />The brush: I had no issue with hair falling out at all, losing only 2 hairs total in 4 uses. I soak the brush in the empty mug in warm water while i shower.<br /><br />The soap: Smells great! I received this set before my razor arrived, so i figured i would learn proper lathering while still using my regular 5 bladed beast. It made my 5 blade razor shave super smooth and comfortable, and once i moved to the straight razor, it provided the protection needed for such a steep learning curve. I put a few drops of warm water on soap before i shower so the top layer is soft.<br /><br />The stand: Quite small, does what it need to allowing your brush to hang dry. My straight razor doesn't stay so well in the stand, but it isnt moving anywhere, so it is fine.<br /><br />The mug: here was my confusion. Was i going to use the mug with the soap puck, and then a separate bowl to build lather? I wasnt sure, so i decided to use a coffee mug for the soap puck. I wet the bottom a bit, and dropped the soap in and let it dry overnight. Now the puck is fixed in the coffee mug nicely. I run the brush around the soap for 45 second to one minute, then use the mug from this set to build lather. I am not so sure this is the ideal solution, since the mug is a bit narrow for swirling lather, and probably makes more sense for the small swirl need to load the soap, and not the lathering part. I will get a small bowl, and try it this way as well.<br /><br />Overall, this allows you to get started, and after just a couple of shaves with my [[ASIN:B002PQZEHQ Parker SR1 Stainless Steel Straight Edge Razor and 5 Shark Super Stainless blades]] i know i have good shaves ahead of me.<br /><br />I dont know about the huge savings factor though. i know many guys go through blades like crazy, and with the 4 or 5 blade ones going for a couple bucks, it adds up. I was using the [[ASIN:B003BVINQI Schick Hydro 5 Blade Razor]] and it is the best of the multi blade razors. I found a cartridge would last me a month (15 shaves) without getting too dull or irritating. SO it was only costing me about $2-3 a month for one or two. Now i spent on a razor, this set, plus i will probably take the advice of others and get a sampler to see which blades are the best for my face. So I am in at almost $60, which could have bought me well over 2 years of cartridges. With the straight shavette, i will have to replace soap, and buy razors as well, albeit cheaper. I am not looking at this as a savings issue to though, and i am very happy so far with how great of a shave i get with a straight shavette.<br /><br />If you have any comment about how i am using the bowl and mug setup, i would be interested to hear!

  109. I'm new to the arena of wet shaving and safety razors, so I don't have a whole lot to compare this to. That said, it's a quality set, and it's pretty hard to beat for the price. The stand is a must so your badger brush can dry properly and it's nice to have a place to put the razor too. For someone who's just getting started with this \\"new\\"-old way of shaving, this set works just fine. The brush seems to be pretty high quality, and it's got a nice weight to it. I did actually lose a couple bristles the first time I used it, but I believe that is fairly normal. As for the stand, I used to have no other choice but to leave my disposable razor on the counter or under the sink, but the stand takes care of that problem. My overall impression is that it's a great starter kit. Short of the razor, it's got everything you need. There is better stuff out there, but if you're just getting started, this will work fine to start with; without breaking the bank.
  110. This kit is a great price for what you get, the bowl alone can go for as much as this entire kit. The soap is un-remarkable, but still a nice freebie that adds variety to your soap choices. The brush is a solid \\"pure\\" quality (quality for badger brushes goes pure -> best -> super/silver-tip). It's a little bit prickly when applying lather to the face, but mellows down somewhat after the first few shaves.<br /><br />All in all it's a great introduction kit, and you can upgrade your brush once you know what features you're looking/paying for.
  111. After causing a near-riot at a local business establishment when they raised the price of the modern bajillion-blade razor cartridges for the fifth time in five months, I realized something had to give. What happened to the days when a man could shave in the solitude of his bathroom without the insult of having it cost him $3 a day? Like so many others who reached the same breaking point, I looked around and found out about the wet shaving renaissance. And then I found this set.<br /><br />Van Der Hagen makes a solid product. Their brushes are sturdy and well-built. Their soap smells terrific and lathers wonderfully. Their mug comes in the standard size and shape which fits pleasantly in the hand and just looks great with the matching brush. And the included stand holds the brush perfectly and is unobtrusive and takes up very little counter space. This set, therefore, is just what you need to augment your razor.<br /><br />What? No razor? No worries folks, they can be found all over the place. One is not included here, presumably because there are many varieties of razors, and individual preferences vary widely. I recommend Merkur or Edwin Jagger models, personally. Either way, this kit presumes that you have already chosen a razor and does not include one.<br /><br />You can buy all of these things separately if you choose, but the price is right with this set. I think if you are just starting out, this will give you a good idea of whether or not the old-fashioned wet shave is for you. You really can't go wrong starting right here with this set.
  112. I recently gave up my Hydro 5 to go to an old fashioned safety razor after becoming fed up with paying way to much for razor heads that never seem to last.<br /><br />So I figured why not take it a step further and ditch the shaving creams and jells and really go old school. After seeing the [[ASIN:B001A3HPT0 Van Der Hagen Premium Shave Set (Soap, Bowl, Brush)]] at the local Rite Aid and talking to a couple of friends who made \\"the switch\\" months before I did, they all told me the same thing; badger brush only, and if you are going to spend money, spend it on the brush.<br /><br />I figured I would spend a couple more bucks, started looking around, and came across this. Not only is the brush pure badger, but the set just looks a lot better than the other product mentioned above and does not break the bank. And lets not forget, I have been using good 'ol cans of cream since I started shaving back in the 7th grade, I didn't want to spend a lot of money just to discover this way wasn't for me.<br /><br />Wow, that's all I can say right now, wow. I can't believe I did not make the switch long ago! The soap smells wonderful, once you work up a good lather its the best cream I have ever used, the brush is soft enough for me (I can see buying a higher grade brush in the future), and lastly, it just looks nice. A clear stand that can hold my razor, a new well built brush, and glossy black shaving cup, what's not to like?<br /><br />So if you are looking for a practical gift for your father, husband, brother, son, neighbor's son, or any shaving man you know, including yourself, don't think twice and just buy this shave set!

  116. I've been using this set for about a month now with an Edwin Jagger de89 razor, and I can honestly say that this combination is the best shave I have had in my 47 years of shaving, I was once a believer of the 'more blades the better' line of thinking, spent a lot of money on expensive blade refills, then a co-worker got me this for a Christmas gift and I will never go back, sometimes simpler is better, this was how my father and grand father shaved, and I believe they had it right, the de89 razor is almost like a piece of art, with it's gleaming chrome and weighty feel, and using the badger hair brush the soap whips into a nice thick pleasant smelling lather, extremely close comfortable shaves,and blade refills are dirt cheap and there many different brands to choose from, so my advice to anyone thinking about trying wet shaving, do it, you won't be sorry.

The brush is nice, the soap works up to a nice lather, and the stand holds the brush and razor perfectly. I could probably do without the logo on the cup, but I'm very particular about things like this and I recognize that it does not affect the function of this at all. Very glad I purchased this!
  118. this is an amazing entry set for any beginner or professional DE shaver. and for its price it's even more amazing. The stand is very handy, the shaving soap lathers up well and smells nice, and the brush is of excellent quality!
  119. Good place to start. My girlfriend loves the smell of the soap.
  120. Nice set for the price, would definitely recommend!
  121. I got this as a present. It's very good construction, and looks high quality. The set is pretty enough to look nice on the counter, and the shave soap smells fantastic.
  122. I bought this set to go along with the first safety razor that I bought and not only is the set amazing to use it is classy as hell.
  123. I got this kit from my wonderful wife as part of my 30th birthday present. I've not used anything other than the blue goop before, so this was a whole new experience. I love it. My new Safety Razor fits perfectly in the stand. Overall I'm very happy with this set.
  124. Like James Bond would say, &#34;sometimes the old ways are the best&#34;. Having that in mind, I wanted to give it a try with the old traditional way of shaving. This was my very first shave set, as I was looking for something affordable and nice. For beginners, this set is really nice. It comes with a brush, mug, shaving soap and a stand (for the brush and shaving blade). However, my biggest issue was with the brush. In less than three weeks of usage (I shaved three times a week), the part that hold all the bristles together, came off from the handle. The brush has been rendered unusable. Now I'm not sure if it was because I was handling the brush inappropriately while preparing the shaving soap, but I was expecting it to last a little longer.
  125. I like the mug that comes with this set, and is one of the main reasons I purchased this product. That being said, the stand is plastic and functions well to hold my DE razor and the supplied badger hair brush. The soap itself is okay but there are much better options to be had. My only complaint, which others seem to share, is that the badger hair brush sheds like crazy. Every single morning, I lose AT LEAST 10 hairs out of this thing. My razor ends up picking them up off of my face. Some people have not had this experience and lucky for them. Unfortunately, I will have to buy a new brush within a year, when these brushes are supposed to last at least a year. In the end, I could have spent 30 dollars elsewhere and been just as satisfied on a better soap and a regular coffee mug.
  126. After only about two weeks of using this the brush has already started falling apart. I gave this as a gift and am very disappointed.
  127. I purchased two of these sets for me and my dad. The bowl and stand area great, plus the soap smells great and when lathered properly works great. The brush however is a different story. After a month or so, my dads brush completely fell apart with all the hair falling out. Mine has started to do the same thing a month or so later. Very poorly made brush. So be fair warned, you are basically buying the bowl and the stand, but don't expect the brush to last.
  128. I bought this kit when I started wet shaving about a year ago. I´m constantly on the lookout for new products and as of yet I have not found a better kit.<br /><br />The bowl is fantastic. It´s really nice and wide (a big plus) and has not chipped at all, even though I have accidentally banged it various of times against the sink. I have used other soaps on it even though they don´t initially fit, I´ve cut the soaps and microwaved them in this bowl for about ten seconds and then left them on the fridge for a couple of hours. Works great.<br /><br />The brush is 100% badger, it´s really nice and bigger than the others I´ve seen. It is much bigger than the famous Tweezerman sold here. I have not experienced shedding at all, so I´m sure the people with the negative reviews have no idea what they´re doing.<br /><br />The soap is decent and lathers well, but the scent is simply amazing. I have tried a few other soaps and my favorite scent so far has been from this one, it´s a bit citrusy and strong. Some find it overpowering but I love it, it makes the bathroom smell awesome!<br /><br />The stand is OK, it´s nice and clear. I prefer it over metal stands that will inevitably stain or rust. Looks fancy, but no big deal.<br /><br />Overall I believe this is a must for anyone new to wet shaving, it´s got all you need except for the razor and blades and all the components are top-notch. Trust me, you will not find a better kit.

The mug is large, heavy, and houses the shaving soap puck just fine. The brush was a little smelly at first, but after a few shaves it went away. It's not the highest quality brush, but it definitely does a great job of creating a thick lather. The stand which holds the brush is very convenient in that it has a slot for your razor.   138. The shaving mug, soap, and stand are fine, but the brush is useless. The bristles are glued together and stuffed into the handle. The bristles fell out of the handle my third time using it. I believe I have some gorilla glue with which I can attempt to repair the brush, but the company should really try making a quality product from the beginning. If you don't already have a decent brush I recommend buying a different product. **Update** I ended up using some waterproof gorilla glue to hold the glued together bristles in place. It is pretty ridiculous that the manufacturer doesn't use better glue to begin with. Customers shouldn't have to modify such basic products in order to make them useful. I still recommend getting a better brush, though, because the bristles are still a bit scratchy and have not softened despite almost daily use for over a year.

  147. Great<br />NIce looking acrylic stand that will hold just about any razor and your brush.<br />Sturdy soap bowl that has heft to it and will create a good lather.<br />Badger bristle brush really softens up nice after 4 shaves.<br /><br />Not So Great<br />Badger brush smells like wet dog until you get past the 6th shave with the brush.<br />Brush bristles separated from the plastic handle... fixed this problem with a bit of cyanoacrylate (Super Glue).<br />Stand is very lightweight and will slide around easily... fixed this with by applying rubber adhesive feet to the bottom of the stand.<br /><br />Other Thoughts<br />Many people complain about the fragrance of the soap. For me it was the scent of the brush that was throwing off the smell of the soap. I would describe the soap as a very light &#34;barbershop&#34; soap smell, which is why wet dog brush overpowers the smell of the soap. :)<br />Seems like the star of this package is the apothecary mug (soap mug).<br /><br />Razor and Blades?<br />I purchased the following both on Amazon.<br />Lord Premium Safety Razor Model LP1822L aka L6<br />25 FEATHER BLUEBIRD ASTRA SHARK LORD DERBY BIC NACET Blade Sampler<br /><br />Conclusion<br />Would I say that this is the best shave kit out there? No. Is it the cheapest shave kit that includes everything that you need to &#34;wet shave&#34; without having to scour the interwebs, while not being a completely &#34;cheap&#34; product? Yes. If you can get past probably having to fix your brush with super glue and can put up with the wet dog scent (maybe you prefer it... to each their own) for a couple shaves. Eventually the brush will lose that smell and be more sturdy after the super glue fix (the bristles rotated in the handle from the beginning fyi) and you will then begin to enjoy the slight fragrance of the soap.<br /><br />However, the main star of any shave set package should be the brush and this one broke in action.<br /><br />Brush is easily fixed with Super Glue butit do seem odd that VanDerHagen does not use cyanoacrylate when gluing this brush together. Instead uses what appears to be and smells like wood glue to fashion the bristles to the handle.<br /><br />Would I buy this again? Maybe. Would I buy this just if I need a shave brush? No.<br /><br />Should you buy this if you want to start wet shaving and don't know what to buy and want a package that has a badger hair brush in it? Yes.
  148. I was new to safety razor shaving and wanted a good set to start with. I saw the reviews for this product on Amazon. The price was reasonable to I gave it a try. I'll review the product by each piece.<br /><br />Apothecary Cup- The cup is very solid and not cheap feeling. It works great at holding heat if you soak your cup in hot water before lathering. The top of the cup is alright for lathering. I would have preferred a shorter cup with a wider mouth but it does the job.<br /><br />Lather Brush- The brush has a nice handle and is made with real badger hair. It works a good lather but sheds hair way more then I would like. The brush will have a smell for the first few uses but will fade away after that.<br /><br />Soap- The soap is standard fare. If you're new to soap lather you may get discouraged trying to learn how to lather correctly. I was doing it wrong for a few weeks. I recommend doing a youtube search on how to lather shaving soap and you will be on your way to greatness.<br /><br />Brush/Razor Stand- A piece of clear plastic with a few cutouts. This holds my safety razor and brush. It is a solid build but not as heavy as it could be. Sometimes I feel like my Merkur 180 will tip this thing over but so far it's worked fine for my needs.
  149. I purchased this product mostly for the apothecary mug, but I also wanted a matching badger brush to go with it. I previously had the Tweezerman shaving brush, and I had no problems with it, but I also needed the stand. This set has been working very well for me. The badger brush is great. A few hairs fell out at first, but I find that's normal with most brushes. It's also larger than the Tweezerman, which I now prefer. The mug looks great. Though I don't really use the handle, it does look interesting because it's a bit different from a normal mug that I know a lot of people use. I have not used the soap yet-- I filled the mug with my own shave soap that I melted down and let set inside the mug. Although the stand isn't very fancy looking, I find it does the job. I didn't have one before, so I had to let my brush dry by laying it on its side or standing on its hairs, but this lets the hairs keep their shape. The stand also accommodates a razor. I use a safety razor and it fits in there, but I image a Mach 3 or Fusion may not fit so well because of their shape.

  157. Despite some unfavorable reviews, I'm thrilled with this product. I've only used the brush and stand so far and it gets the job done and the quality is great - regardless of price. So the pot and soap are a bonus in my mind.<br /><br />I'm a daily shaver with moderate growth. I stumbled upon a men's shaving cream at Bath and Body and ended up buying a few tubes and wanted to go old school, like dad used to. The only similar product I've used was when my father would teasingly put some lather on my 5 yr old face using his brush - 35 years ago. Clearly, that was a much better experience, but I'm sure that was because of the 'barber' and not the brush.<br /><br />This process is great compared to the pump and primp shaving creams and gels. You really feel the brush against the grain and the facial hair is raised for clean and easy shave. It leaves a clean and comfortable feeling every morning.<br /><br />Based on other reviews, I take it gentle with the brush and avoid traveling with it. I speculate that if I flick it hard every morning to get the residual water out after rinsing, it may fall apart. So I'm extra careful and flick only with squeezing the bristles with my fingers.<br /><br />Great product, great shave. Well worth the price.

  183. I recently decided to switch to wet-shaving, so this is my first kit. Initially, I can say that I'm greatly pleased. The brush: The brush is 100% pure badger hair, so it's good, but not like the more expensive brushes. (UPDATE: I personally prefer boar brushes like Omega now. This one got too flimsy for my preference after 1.5 years). Like all brushes, there is a stinky smell when the bristles are first wet, but this went away after soaking the brush in hot water, washing with shampoo, and two uses while shaving. Lathers very well, and feels nice on the face. The black handle looks sleek and is easy to grip. (UPDATE: The handle and brush head are pretty small, so I like I mentioned earlier, I prefer larger brushes like Omega now). The bowl: Nice sized bowl. The included shave soap fits in perfectly. The sides are high, which is great for not spilling while lathering. Sturdy construction and nice sleek design. Was a little dusty from packaging (as was everything else), but can't complain about that. The stand: Just a simple acrylic stand. Brush fits in perfectly, and my razor hangs nicely as well. Not the most sturdy thing, but it does its job. Sort of tacky looking due to the clear material, but it does its job. The soap: Amazing soap! Lathers nicely and smells amazing! A nice fresh scent that isn't overpowering. It actually freshens up my whole bathroom sitting in the cup after a shave. It does a great job of preventing irritation while shaving, so great all around! I was torn between buying this product, or its cheaper companion, the Van der Hagen premium set. I'd say the extra $20 for the higher quality brush, bigger bowl, and stand make it worth it.
  184. Junk. After a couple dozen shaves the brush broke loose from the handle. Even more annoying since it was a gift from my wife. Spend a little more on a top quality brush.
  185. My razor is too tall to sit in the stand, it really needs to be about an inch taller. I had previously bought the cheaper model without the stand, and will probably switch back to that one.
  186. I bought two shave sets, one for my husband and the other for my father. They both love them. My husband raved over it again and again. My father even threw away his old brush which he has had forever. And he never throws things he likes away. That says a lot. Thank you for this product. We recommend this it to any man who wants to or does shave with a brush and mug. It also looks sleek and manly.
  187. I got this for my husband and he seems to really like it. Uses it every morning and likes the soap that came with it.
  188. The product is one of the best shaving mugs I have had the soap is very good the brush is excellent quality
  189. I was very happy with this product . I gave it to my Son for Christmas . He was very happy with it . It has lasted a long time .
  190. I always wanted a beaver shaving brush and so far for the price this set has been great. I highly recommend using it because it allows you to get a close shave. The only bad thing i notice is that the brush smells but i heard it eventually goes away...but for the price one cant really complain
  191. Got this for my husband as a father's day gift. He loved it: &#34;I felt like such a gentleman.&#34; He has very sensitive skin, and said this really helped. Next on the list is a straight razor for him.
  192. cool set just wish the brush was softer
  193. Great set! Only down fall is the brush smells terrible for a while until it's had some good use
  194. Well. The bowl is really nice, I'll give it that, the stand works well. The soap does take a little elbow grease. Doesn't make an extremely cushy lather like some other soaps but it is very slick on your face if you know how to lather soap. If you're looking for a strong smelling soap look elswhere. The best thing to do is take a about a teaspoon of hot water from your tap and pour it on top of the puck towards the end of soaking your brush for about 3-5 minutes. The brush is very rough to start but this is normal. Make sure you soak it well every time and soak it and work it in your hand a couple times in hot water over a couple days before you use it, or you will get one hell of a brush burn on your face. The brush stinks, as do most hair brushes when you get them, but i've been using this kit for about two weeks now and it still has not gone away, while its not as strong anymore, you can still smell it through the shave soap. Not the greatest kit in the world, but the bowl and stand are really nice, and the soap and brush will make good back ups, or very least a good starter kit for a newbie. I would give it higher marks if it wasn't for the brush stinking so bad. Solid kit.
  195. This is a great looking set. You cant really tell by looking at the picture but the shaving cream bowl is pretty big. It all looks great together, especially with my new Edwin Jagger Safety Razor.
  196. I was introduced to wet shaving only months ago when, for Father's Day, my son surprised me with the Van Der Hagen Men's Luxury Shave Kit, an [[ASIN:B003LW4LJK Edwin Jagger De86bl Faux Ebony Double Edge Safety Razor, Black]] and some [[ASIN:B001OXTHJC Astra Superior Platinum Double Edge Razor Blades - 30 Ct]] blades. I was surprised how the VDH kit exudes quality well beyond its very modest price: the flared black ceramic mug has a classic shape and heft, the badger hair brush is soft and lush and its chrome-trimmed black handle cradles comfortably in the palm, the soap lathers up luxuriously (as its name would suggest), and the acrylic stand, while not a traditional material or design, is very functional, providing a rest for both brush and razor (even including a dimple to stand a straight razor upright). I quickly found I can spend quite a large amount on similar items individually, should I become a shaving connoisseur or collector. There may well be finer, certainly more expensive, products out there in the burgeoning market of wet shaving products, but I am quite happy with this kit as it is. For price and quality, the VDH kit is the bomb.
  197. This is a great kit for beginners who want to dip their feet into wet shaving, but aren't prepared to spend a lot of money. Unfortunately in this case, you get what you pay for. For starters, be aware that this brush sheds a LOT. A little shedding is to be expecting on the first few uses, but after two months, I'm still losing clumps of hair with each shave. On top of this, I do not believe this brush is 100% badger as described. While this brush is reasonably soft, it is nowhere near as soft as many badger brushes I've felt since this purchase. The brush is well constructed and feels good in your hand, but it is not a joy to actually use. The hairs are a bit coarse and tend to poke at the skin. I've since dropped $30 on a true badger brush. The soap smells great, but is a trick to lather. A tiny amount of water on the brush will result in a thin, bubbly foam that doesn't coat the skin well. But no water on the brush, and the soap won't lather at all. After two months of practice I still haven't gotten the hang of it. Maybe it's just me, but I've ordered a different brand of soap to try. All that said, I love this bowl I love the look and feel of it. I'm a tall guy with large hands, and this bowl just fits so comfortably in my grip. It's absolutely perfect. The stand is also very well-constructed, though the clear acrylic may not fit the aesthetic that some would expect to see in this kind of set up. I've noticed more experienced wet shavers prefer a metal or wooden stand. But this is entirely personal preference for the \\"look\\" of your kit. As I said, the stand works great for what it does. I would definitely not recommend this kit for the seasoned wet shaver. This kit is made for beginners, and priced as such.
  198. This has been a great starter set for me. I don't shave more than once or twice a week, but the results are always very good and I get great lather with the brush and soap. The only complaint I have is that the razor just doesn't fit in the slot on the stand very well and tends to fall out if you bump it, but other than that I'm very happy with my purchase.
  199. I like the cup but the bristles came out of the handle not long after purchasing this item. I glued them back in and haven't had a problem since. Not real thrilled with the design of the stand for brush and razor. Will probably buy a different stand.

  211. After two months of ownership, I am ready to make my assessment: I love this set. It looks excellent on my countertop, the brush lathers well and feels great on the skin, the mug makes lathering extremely easy, and the stand is very functional in that it holds the brush and my razor perfectly. I had a little trouble lathering the soap, but i am relatively new to wet shaving and I am not about to take off points from the review based on my lack of technique, particularly when many people have had excellent results with it. I use [[ASIN:B002L03N74 CO Bigelow Premium Menthol Shave Cream with Eucalyptus Oil - 5.2 oz]] in the mug instead and it works beautifully. I plan on upgrading the brush to a silvertip when this brush meets its end, which shouldn't be for a while as I am not having the issue with shedding that others seem to have experienced. For the price, this set cannot be beat.
  212. good smells creamy smooth
  213. This is a great set for the price. A couple of notes though: First, this set includes a \\"pure badger\\" brush. This is the lowest grade of badger hair (higher grades, in ascending order are \\"fine badger\\" and \\"silvertip badger\\") and often has the tips cut off in order to form the brush shape. If the tips are cut the brush won't wear in as well, so I was hoping this wasn't the case but it is. Given this, the brush is a little scratchy and will stay that way. The upside is that it works up a very good lather, but I wouldn't recommend this for anyone with sensitive skin. Second, the apothecary mug is meant to have the soap left in the bottom. The soap that's included has a pleasant mild scent, lathers up well, and fits nicely into the mug, so that's nice. However, you might have difficulty using other soaps with it and the remaining space is difficult to work up enough lather in. It would be nice if it were a little taller and tapered out further with a milder slant. For the price and what's included, it's still a great set. I got this set along with the [[ASIN:B003LW4LJK Edwin Jagger De86bl Faux Ebony Double Edge Safety Razor, Black]], which fits nicely in the stand, matches the style, and is a great value as well.
  214. I have read the reviews, and users complaining about breaking. Should have listened to them. It was exactly as they mentioned. I can not believe they didn't use good quality gum to stick those two pieces. send a mail to manufacturer, no response. I would give 0 starts if it was an option.<br /><br />On the other note, I like the cup and soap. There were no issues with them.

  218. I use a straight razor not one of those sissy-boy safety razors so you know you're talkin to a real man here and I'm going to give you a real man's opinion on this product.<br />I got this last night and used it for the first time. The brush is soft enough to take your face to Valhalla on the cool breeze of the summer ocean yet still strong enough to get under the titanium like hair that grows out of my face. The bowl is a nice porcelain material that is light enough to hold comfortably, yet strong enough to beat someone over the head if they interrupt your sacred shaving time. The mere sight of me holding it made my wife instantly gasp and run to the kitchen to make me a sandwich.<br />The soap produces a perfect lather and the smell of it is just on par with &#34;Come here woman&#34; and &#34;I've probably killed a shark with my hands&#34;.<br />The stand that comes with it holds the brush perfectly, however, I could not see it being able to hold a safety razor at the same time, but that's okay for me since I'm not a woman and don't use one.<br /><br />All and all this is a great product through and through. it will have you with a close shave while you sing whatever Celine Dion song you prefer.<br />This would be a great deal at twice it's price.   219. It took me two tries to get a set without a broken mug, but it was worth the hassle. * Brush - This brush is really nice, especially for the price. It is much better than my lower-end badger brush I purchased from The Art of Shaving. It is a medium sized brush that builds a great lather quickly and holds a decent amount of water. Quite a few hairs will fall out in the first couple of uses, but that is to be expected I suppose. * Stand - Ok this is pretty useless, but if you don't have a stand for your brush and razor it will do. It isn't fancy but the construction is solid. * Mug - Some people don't like building a lather in the apothecary mug. If I use a bit more water in my brush than I would if I were just loading it, it seems to build fine in the mug. In fact, I think it builds very quickly. They key is using enough water. * Soap - The luxury line soap is fantastic. Nice smooth lather and a pleasant scent. Overall this is a good deal for the new wet shaver or someone looking to ugprade their shaving setup.

The soap lathers up fairly quickly. I like the stand as it not only holds the brush it also holds the razor, this is a plus as the razor doesn't get moved around to dull the blade.I would definitely recommend this to a friend.<br /><br />Product update 9/1/13: I've been using this product for about 3 weeks and found it to be excellent. Some of the reviews said the brush looses bristles, like any good natural hair brush weather it be a house painters brush or an artist brush this is normal.<br />The soap lathers quickly. One reviewer said it was hard to lather, I found this to be somewhat true, the solution is to wet the soap down a little and it lathers fine. I would recommend this product for anyone that wants to shave with a brush and mug.

  233. This kit is full of great products!<br /><br />The soap: it has a pleasing, mild, masculine scent. It lathers easily, and is very lubricating. It works best if pre-soaked in hot water for a moment and drained before being worked up.<br /><br />The brush: it holds a good deal of water, builds lather well, and takes up excess lather (great for later passes!). It also rinses clean with no fussing. The bristles do NOT fall over willy-nilly; you'll be able to use the semi-rigid bristles with authority when you want to.<br /><br />The mug: foremost -- it's handsome. (That's the only distinction I notice between 'shave mugs' and latte mugs) It's also a nice size, shape, and weight. It's a good balance between paying a few dollars for a bathroom display piece and going overboard on laughably-overpriced, purpose-built apothecary mugs.<br /><br />On balance, I'm glad the only thing I didn't like was the stand. I swear, I even *looked* at it funny and it dropped my brush! (A dab of hot glue fixed the tilt problem.)

If you move the stand while the razor is in it be carful to keep it from falling out.
  266. I got this set for my husband, who has very sensitive skin. He shaves, and his face is red for hours. I've tried many sensitive skin products for him, and after doing some research, I thought I would try this kit to see if using shaving soap made a difference. Wow, it sure does! His face has so much less irritation after shaving now. He loves it!
  267. I started shaving with a straight razor a while back and got this shave set to go along with it. It's a good little set with basically most everything you need. The soap is fine. The fact that it comes with a stand for the brush is nice. That way you can use it, and set the brush in the stand to dry off for the next shave. I was a little disappointed with the brush itself. Within a couple of shaves, the hairs began to come out. Not sure if that is supposed to happen, but I expected it to last a little longer before that started. For the price, it was fine. That said; if you are able, I might suggest holding out and spending more on a quality brush designed to last.<br /><br />This would be a good set for someone just getting into shaving with a straight razor and not wanting to really invest a lot into before you're sure this is what you want. If you're thinking this would be a good gift for someone who already uses a straight razor, I would encourage you to aim a little higher. Anyone who already does this will be able to tell.
  268. Alright, so i'm going to start off saying i watched this item for a while, until i finally saw it placed at a friends house where it in person it didn't look as flimsy or bad as i had expected so went with the purchase. If you are in the market for a safety razor and badger brush and stand, then in all honestly you shouldn't bother looking any further. This is the most reasonably priced stand, brush and dish you will be able to find. Other companies, which shall remain un-named, charge ridiculous amounts of money for the same if not a proprietary functioning device similar to this. Now, i'll break this up into Pros and Cons as usual.<br /><br />Pros<br />- Affordability<br />- Functionality<br />- Badger Brush is of mediocre quality, not to say its bad, if purchased alone that would still cost anywhere between $20-30.<br />- stand is very functional, i was able to put in a mach 5 razr, and what i actually use it for, my safety razor.<br />- stand is sturdy, won't fall over while taking anything off the stand or placing it on.<br />- the base is well designed to equally distribute the weight so it won't tip over, fall over.<br />- there is actually a slight groove where the blade, razr, would go that allows to sit, and drain properly so you won't let anything rust<br />- since there is no metal like the other stands, you never have to worry about it rusting,<br />- the soap dish is well made, sturdy, easy to grip and lather up<br /><br />Cons<br />- my safety razor doesn't go all the way down to the base, some MAY consider this a con cause it hangs off the top, but i haven't had it fall out, tip over anything so far.<br />- look or appeal, it is plastic, literally, so don't expect it to \\"wow\\" you when you get in the mail. This is one of those things that in the long term its functionality will wow you, not the appearance like many others on the market.<br />- do wish the base had run off drains, so water wouldn't pool, but does clean very easy<br />- the base is flatplastic, so when water does get under it (btw the stand and counter) it will stay, may want to consider placing a rubber non-slip mat under it<br /><br />Over all i've been using this set now for over a month i would highly recommend this to anyone even if you are going to be using just for a regular disposable razor.
  269. The brush is OK. 2 weeks of use and smell of badger still in it. The brush and razor holder is also OK, but does not hold well Edwin Jagger razor.   270. I ordered this thinking it would be a great looking and functional gift. However, when I received it, the windmill logo on the badger brush was scratched (right across the center of the windmill, making it look old and worn) so that the white paint used to print it onto the brush was flaking. Since I wanted to give it as a gift, this defect was unacceptable! I called Amazon CS and they said they'd send me a replacement in 2 days (for some policy reason I'd never heard of they were not able to generate a replacement order for a certain # of hours). Dissatisfied with this I called CS again, and this time the representative told me they'd ship that'd afternoon and it'd get to me the next day (I needed it w/in 2 days for my gifting purposes). Thanks goodness I ordered with some buffer time. However, the first replacement set I got had the same issue, as well as the 2nd replacement (my guess is there was a mix up and they didn't cancel my first replacement order, but I sent both back regardless). Not sure what was going on here, since I'd never had Amazon botch an order twice, let alone 3 times. I just couldn't believe that all 3 iterations of the same product had the same issue. Then I took a close look at the photos other reviewers had uploaded, and none seem to have the defective brush logo scratch that I did. Perhaps bad luck on my part? I'm still not sure what happened here. Will most likely limit my purchase of this brand in the future, since Amazon did their best to fix the situation.

  278. I used to cringe each time when buying shaving gel canisters and overpriced cartridge refills for my old Gillette Mach 3/Fusion razors, so finally I figured that I'd try shaving with double edge safety razor. I did a lot of research into it and saw that most of the variations in good and bad experiences with shaving with a DE safety razor included a number of smaller, contributing factors, but primarily only two main factors: the type of razor blade and the type of shaving brush. While I completely was expecting that people to vastly different experiences with different razor blades, I certainly didn't think that a shaving brush would make any sort of difference. Nevertheless, since I was new to using a DE safety razor, I figured I'd trust the advice of long-time DE safety blade users and try to find a decent brush, specifically one made of badger hair.<br /><br />I came across this set while looking for a badger hair brush. I liked that it came with a brush/razor stand as well as a soap dish and soap all for a pretty reasonable price. Since I had never tried a DE safety razor before, I didn't want to shell out a lot of money for the initial investment, because to be honest, I had no idea if I was going to like it or not. The aesthetics of the dish, brush, and stand really appeal to me. It looks nice enough to sit on my bathroom counter all the time, and the clear stand bring to the focus to the brush and razor. The brush itself seems to be pretty well made, but it has lost a number of bristles over the last few months. I would say that probably every other time I shave, it loses a bristle or two. The shaving soap feels and smells great. It lathers pretty well and shaving with it is very smooth, although I do use another product ([[ASIN:B000RIAD0W Proraso Pre and Post Shave Cream - 3.6 oz]]) with it as well, so I can't say for sure which one contributes more . Eventually, when the brush wears out, I'll probably put a little money into a better one...but overall I'mvery happy with this set, especially considering the overall value.
  279. I bought this item about 6 months ago, and have used it since. Only complaint is that the hairs on the brush kept falling out, at first a lot, but now not so much.   280. Perfect gift for your boyfriend! Highly recommend this set!
  281. Nice product, should have cover for bowl. Price reduced by 5 dollars day after it received it
  282. I just started using a safety razor and considered this to be a great companion for a good shave. I didn't want to splurge on some of the more aesthetically pleasing pieces just starting out and this kit definitely delivers the goods for what it is. As for each component, here is my take.<br /><br />Brush<br />After unboxing the kit I promptly cleaned the brush with shampoo and warm water and allowed it to dry on the stand. The first use saw a good amount of the bristle hairs coming out which has decreased over the past month of use. I soak the brush in the cup with hot water and it softens up the hairs quite nicely before applying the shave cream. I saw a huge difference in the amount of lather using the shave cream I traditionally use. This is highly important for me because I shave my head and the extra lather really helps prevent the soap from dissipating during the length of the shave. The brush works well with bar soaps such as the included one, although I don't particularly care for the scent of the one in the package.<br /><br />Stand<br />You get what you pay for in regards to looks with the simple clear plastic design. It is a good idea to rest it on a small hand towel to keep it from sticking to the counter when it gets wet. It doesn't take up a lot of counter space which is a huge plus for anyone who knows what it is like to share a bathroom cluttered with hair dryers, tooth brushes, and all kinds of other random objects. My razor handle (a little cheapie from the local beauty supply store) has a bit of a hard time staying in place as I move the stand around; I don't have a problem with this and it may only be my razor but holding onto the handle while putting the stand away is a good idea so you don't accidentally allow the blade to slip and cut your hand. Overall it does the job I want it to do: hold my brush and razor.<br /><br />Shaving Mug<br />I can't say enough how much I love this thing. It is nice and solid and the grip is great. It fits well on the counter and isn't at all slippery when wet so placing it in the shower is not a problem at all. This mug is definitely staying with me after I upgrade my set in the future.<br /><br />Shave Soap<br />I don't particularly care for the musk scent of this soap, but that doesn't mean that it does not get the job done. I have used it a few times and it provides a decent lather.<br /><br />Overall this set is exactly what it is supposed to be. I give it five stars because I didn't expect perfection with this set but a great starter kit which this is. I know I will upgrade items over time as they wear besides the shaving mug. This is a good first set for someone looking to get into the more traditional (and economically friendly with the price of blades nowadays) form of shaving.
  283. This is a nice complete shave kit for the money. I would like a little more fragrant scent, as the scent of the shave crème and balm is a bit subtle and non descript like soap. I also use Art of Shaving Products, and prefer that line's sandalwood and lemon scents a bit better. Crème and balm work well and give it a 4 out of 5 stars.

  307. UPDATE 12/4/2013: The brush with this starter set fell apart the other day, so I'm adding this comment to report what happened. Be aware that the brush is actually constructed using a wax-like glue to hold the bristles together at its base. The brush has a metal ring around its base, and this is inserted into the handle. Glue is applied around the bottom of the bristles to hold it in the handle. This quality of construction is poor. Most people soak their brush in hot water before shaving. With this type of brush construction, soaking the brush in hot water loosens the glue, making it prone to failure. For this reason, I'm downgrading my rating for this item from four stars to three stars.<br /><br />If you purchase this set, do not use your hand to squeeze excess water out of the brush. Doing so can pull the bristles and wax out of the handle. Rather, shake the brush to remove extra water. Treat the brush gently to ensure the assembly remains intact.<br /><br />A quality brush uses knots, not wax, to hold the bristles together. With this brush, you'll notice some badger hairs will fall out, over time. Given the low price of this set, I still see it as a nice starter for those new to wet shaving. Just be aware that you'll probably want or need to replace the brush eventually.<br /><br />The following is my original review.<br /><br />------------------------------------<br /><br />Getting started with a safety razor can be an expensive proposition. You have the razor, which can set you back anywhere between $35 for a cheapy to $300 or more for a high-quality shaver. You have the cup, the soap, the brush, the shaver and brush holder, the balms, salves, creams, lotions. OMG! If you're like me, you want to save money and not have to spend a fortune on replacement razors for your store-bought shaver. The good news is that all these things are a one-time expense. Once you're up and running, the price of quality blades is where you'll save your money to pay for all these other items, over time.<br /><br />The Van Der Hagen shave set gives you everything you need to get started, sans shaver, at a very reasonable price. It's a starter set for those new to this form of shaving, and it can be used by those experienced also.<br /><br />The set comes with a ceramic cup that nicely houses the supplied soap cake. The cup size supports many other manufactured soap cakes also. The cup handle is a little small for those of us with large hands, so if you have large hands, you may want to wrap your digits securely around the entire cup, lest the little handle slips out from between your soapy fingers. A badger brush is provided that is of acceptable quality, although if you take to this form of shaving, you'll probably want to upgrade the brush, in time. A stylish, thick, transparent plastic holder has cutouts to hold the brush and your razor.<br /><br />I've been using this set for a few weeks now and like it. It does what it's intended to do and doesn't break the bank. The quality of the soap is adequate, although it lacks the slickness I can get from other brands of soap, but it's perfectly acceptable. It's easy on my skin and leaves a mild, clean scent that isn't overpowering.<br /><br />If you're looking for a starter set and are beginning your ventures into the relaxing world of wet shaving, I'd definitely recommend the Van Der Hagen shave set. In time, I plan to upgrade the brush, but for now, this is fine. I'm definitely going to change the soap cake to something with more slickness. What's nice about this set is that it's a one-stop purchase for those who want to get started with the basic essentials at a reasonable price.or all these other items, over time.<br /><br />The Van Der Hagen shave set gives you everything you need to get started, sans shaver, at a very reasonable price. It's a starter set for those new to this form of shaving, and it can be used by those experienced also.<br /><br />The set comes with a ceramic cup that nicely houses the supplied soap cake. The cup size supports many other manufactured soap cakes also. The cup handle is a little small for those of us with large hands, so if you have large hands, you may want to wrap your digits securely around the entire cup, lest the little handle slips out from between your soapy fingers. A badger brush is provided that is of acceptable quality, although if you take to this form of shaving, you'll probably want to upgrade the brush, in time. A stylish, thick, transparent plastic holder has cutouts to hold the brush and your razor.<br /><br />I've been using this set for a few weeks now and like it. It does what it's intended to do and doesn't break the bank. The quality of the soap is adequate, although it lacks the slickness I can get from other brands of soap, but it's perfectly acceptable. It's easy on my skin and leaves a mild, clean scent that isn't overpowering.<br /><br />If you're looking for a starter set and are beginning your ventures into the relaxing world of wet shaving, I'd definitely recommend the Van Der Hagen shave set. In time, I plan to upgrade the brush, but for now, this is fine. I'm definitely going to change the soap cake to something with more slickness. What's nice about this set is that it's a one-stop purchase for those who want to get started with the basic essentials at a reasonable price.
  308. All you need is a safety razor.<br /><br />2 things sold me on this kit:<br />The stand will hold a safety razor along with the brush. I saw other kits with metal stands but every review said the stand would fall apart. No mention of this stand breaking of falling apart without extreme conditions.<br /><br />Badger hair brush. In educating myself on proper techniques, and preferred products. Badger hair is preferred over boar hair, in feel, lather, longevity, and heat retention. Boar brushes usually cost more, finding this in a kit was wonderful.<br /><br />I haven't had any problems with the brush that a lot of reviews are mentioning. I purchased this item on August 23, 2013. Occasional hair fall out but that was expected with a new brush. I suggest once getting the kit to work the brush with some soap in the hand a couple times to work the loose hairs out.<br /><br />Along with this kit I purchaced [[ASIN:B000NL0T1G Merkur Model 180 Long Handled Safety Razor]] and [[ASIN:B004UIZFQW 35 FEATHER 7 O'clock SHARK ASTRA BLUEBIRD DERBY Blade Sampler]] to figure out what I liked best.

  313. This is a really good place to start if you are new to DE wet shaving. It's also a good everday set if you just want to DE wetshave and save some money.
