Our dads and grandpas used these things everyday to shave. They used the basic stuff. No $100 badger brushes or $200 dollar safety razors. They seemed to survive just fine. This set has a decent brush, bowl and stand. I have yet to use the shave cream disc but I'm sure it would be fine too. In fact, I just ordered this set for my son for Christmas. He wants to wet shave and always uses my stuff when he is home from college. I got him this set, a tube of porasso, and an EJ DE 89bl. He will be set for shaving for a long while.
  314. If you've looked into badger brushes you know that they can get fairly expensive. This set is a nice set. The mug is great, the soap is nice, the stand is very useful, but the brush shreds way too much. The brush does work very well however. I can get loads of lather if I get the soap-water ratio correct. I usually just load the brush with soap by swirling it around on the soap about 30-40 times then around in the mug for about a minute. If I don't get the proper lather then I start adding water a little at a time until the mug is overflowing. The shedding is the only reason this set doesn't get five stars.
  315. Bought this starter set and the brush fell out of the handle after using it 15-20 times. EDIT: Contacted the company about my brush failure and received a replacement from them. Changed review from 1 star to 4.
  316. I bought this as a gift. Its really the best value I could find for soap, cup, brush, and brush stand that I could find. I don't love the aesthetic of the acrylic stand, but the brush and cup are nice. Note: not all soaps will fit in this cup! If a soap does not fit, just melt it in a dish in the microwave for a bit, then carefully shove it into the cup. It wont look pretty, but it works. Also, the brush does smell at first. Several soaks in vinegar & water along with a few uses faded the odor.
  317. It's not a terrible set to start with and are commonly avaliable at allot of stores. But, the brush never stops shedding, and the stand will let you're razor slip off easily so do not put you're expensive razor on it , but i like the mug it's the best part of this set; you can get a better shaving mug for $25 dollar!

  322. So i received this kit on Apr 2, 2013, and i like it.<br />When I first opened the box, the stand came out broken at the top (although there was no visible damage to the exterior of the box), but a little superglue at the joint took care of it pretty well, and is still holding strong today (4 months later).<br />The apothecary mug is great; it looks fantastic as part of the decor, and the finish holds up really well and cleans easily.<br />The soap it came with smells pretty good, although i may go with a different brand, just to get a sense of different lathers and textures and smells. It fits great in the mug, and can stay there. (For those of you who have not used a set like this, or are just starting out... the soap stays in the bottom of the mug, and you wet your brush ans scrub the soap to make lather in it. After each shave, the soap will dry up, back to normal. It makes cleanup easy, as you only need to rinse your brush).<br /><br />The reason i gave a 4 out of 5 is because of the brush.<br />It seems that the bristles are either, not holding up, not staying in, or of poor quality.<br />I'm starting to get a few of the bristles to &#34;fray outwards&#34; kind of like an old paintbrush. But i will account that to normal use, or maybe i'm misusing it... i dont know... but i wont fault Van Der Hagen for that.<br />I've also heard that the brisltes falling out is kind of like a break in period... each time i shave i'll get 5 or 6 bristles fall out.<br />It doesnt seem to be slowing down either. I've been using it for 4 months, 4 times a week. About 64 shaves.<br /><br />All in all it was an inexpensive set, but at a very good value... especially if you are a novice and don't want a lot of startup costs.<br />I would recommend this product.<br /><br />I'll give an update in a few months regarding bristles.
  323. The brush and bowl are made in China and the brush smells horrible.<br /><br />The soap is made somewhere else and it doesn't lather at all. I followed the instructions to a T but no matter what I tried it just creates a soapy brush. Less water or more water, hot or cold, more pressure or less nothing helped.<br /><br />I did try to shave with the soap and it doesn't provide any benefits over just wetting your face with water and shaving.<br /><br />I must be odd man out as this kit was a waste of time for me. The stand does hold the brush and a razor. It is not tall enough to fit the bowl under the brush though.
  324. Provides everything you need to start: mug, soap, badger hair brush, and brush holder.<br /><br />This set exudes a high-quality feel with an average build quality and aesthetic. The brush holder is clear acrylic, and I've taken to not using it at all due to its tenancy to easily become dirty. It does have a slot to hold a safety razor, however, which I found useful at first.<br /><br />The mug is a pleasure to use, and has stayed in one piece despite multiple drops into my sink and onto the floor. The included soap isn't whipped or easy to lather at all, and is perhaps the cheapest component of the set.<br /><br />Some time is needed to break the badger hair brush in, as the bristles are a little prickly at first. After about a year of use, the wax and hairs of the brush slid out of the handle, and was a simple job to glue back together. Continued aggressive use of the brush definitely caused wear and damage, so I'll probably be upgrading to a more expensive, higher quality brush soon.<br /><br />This is definitely an excellent and affordable shaving set for anyone thinking about trying an older-style shave before committing.
  325. This Van Der Hagen Luxury shaving set is outstanding. The Badger brush is of excellent quality and the shaving soap is very smooth and provides a great shave. The mug and stand are also of excellent quality. This whole set is a great value. You can't go wrong with Van Der Hagen. Thank you very much Amazon.com for a Super-fast delivery. I ordered this set on Friday evening and received it Monday afternoon. Excellent service. AAAAA+++++.
  326. I've been using this brush for the past 3 months, and it's ok. Not great, just ok. It lathers well, but I stay away from using it mainly because it's a nuisance to keep taking the hairs off of my face everytime I use it. I thought the balding of my brush would go away, but it still sheds at a regular pace (5 - 7 hairs per shave). This occurs mainly from the middle of the brush, thus, I think it's a manufacturing issue (not enough glue holding the brush hairs in place with the handle). I'm going to try and return this brush, but it's already been a while...

  328. I gave this 4 stars because of the value of the package, but almost gave it 3 because of an issue I had with the brush (see end of review). I have looked at other badger hair brushes that cost over $50, just for the brush. Now, they might be the best brushes ever, I wouldn't know, but I know that the one that came with this kit works just fine.<br /><br />I don't use the shaving soap that came with this, but rather the Proraso Refresh Shaving Soap that so many others have recommended. It's great!<br /><br />The stand for the razor and brush works fine, but it's just clear plastic, so nothing special.<br /><br />The cup works well, and I can hold it easily in my hand while using the brush to work the shaving soap into a good lather. I saw that someone else who posted a review here said they use a small bowl that was meant for salsa, and I think that would work a bit better. This one, while not small per se, feels like there is not much room at the bottom, so not much room to swirl the brush around for the lather. Still, I got used to it and it works.<br /><br />One note about the brush. The brush hairs came loose from the handle when I was squeezing the water out of the hairs, i.e. after rinsing out the soap. This was probably partially 'user error', but also just cheap manufacturing. I used just the hairs for a couple of days, since they are bundled together by some glue or resin, and then I used some crazy glue to put it back together. A simple fix,and the brush feels a bit more solid than before. Your mileage may vary.

  346. I decided I had enough of paying high prices for only a 4 multiblade pack for today's razors that individually didn't seem to last that long or shave exceptionally well. So I bought a DE safety razor on line and decided to try going back to the old shaving days of my dad. I also wanted to try out using a brush and shaving bowl just like I remembered him doing when I was a youngster. This shaving kit looked like it should work fine for me.<br /><br /> I like everything about it except for one temporary thing that I'll explain at the end.<br />1. The clear acrylic shaving stand gave me a place to hang my Merkur HD razor as well as the brush that came with this kit. It is simple and the fact that it is clear should allow it to fit nicely in almost any decor.<br />2. The soap and bowl are very nice. I really like the light masculine scent the soap has and it seems to work pretty well. You can almost hear 'Timberrr' as your beard hairs fall away.<br />3. The brush: I was concerned about a few reviews I had read that said the brush had a bad smell to it. Mine had no smell at all when it arrived but unfortunately after using it in hot water and as I began to apply soap to my face I thought it smelled nasty. I washed and rinsed it in shampoo about 4 times and it still smelled a bit at that point like faint burnt rubber. Finally after a couple more wash and rinses it thankfully did lose that odor and has been fine from then on. I wondered if this initial smell was normal with new badger brushes. But since most reviewers of this set have not even mentioned it at all I am guessing that it is not the norm.<br /> - Overall I would still recommend this shaving set.If you are unlucky enough to get a brush that seems to smell funny when initially used/wet then remember to use a nice scented shampoo on it; keep lathering and rinsing it and it will eventually lose its bad odor. Happy shaving!
  347. I'm new to DE shaving, and when making the initial investment, buying a starter-kit seemed to make a lot of financial sense. Every site that I referenced during my research said that you should invest in a badger hair brush. This kit has one, and the price certainly is very reasonable.<br /><br />**The Brush**<br />This brush is 100% pure badger hair. It's soft to the touch, and does a good job with lathering/applying the shave soap. Some other reviewers had some complaints about loose hairs and an odor. Well, a bit of quick research will tell you that you should expect to find a few hairs in the lather (in the bowl, or on your face) during the first several shaves, as you need to break in the brush. These hairs were probably relatively loose to begin with, but the manufacturer wasn't able to remove them before shipping. I also read that you can expect a few hairs to come out during the life of the brush - especially during the first few months after it breaks in. If you have clumps falling out, then the product is defective. In short, don't worry if you see a few hairs here and there! As far as the smell, well... it's made of animal hair, and it smells very faintly like wet animal after you wet it. It's not oppressive, and the soap that comes with this seems to cover it up. Don't worry... if the faint odor is even remotely offensive, it'll go away in a short while.<br /><br />**The Soap**<br />The Van Der Hagen soap that comes in this kit if perfectly serviceable. It smells nice (the perfume seems to be used sparingly here,) lathers up decently well with only a little effort, and most importantly, rinses very easily. Many websites will recommend this even to veteran shavers, as it's affordable, gentle, and effective.<br /><br />**The Stand**<br />It's a clear plastic stand. It is exactly the right size to hold the brush and my Merkur Model 180 Long Handled Razor. It might not be pretty to look at, but it works and won't really clash with any of your bathroom decor. No complaints here!<br /><br />In the end, I'd recommend this starter kit to any of my friends who're interested in wet-shaving. I'm not sure that I'd replace anything in it anytime soon (except maybe the stand, if I find an affordable one that looks better.)our bathroom decor. No complaints here!<br /><br />In the end, I'd recommend this starter kit to any of my friends who're interested in wet-shaving. I'm not sure that I'd replace anything in it anytime soon (except maybe the stand, if I find an affordable one that looks better.)

  349. great set for the price. i love the soap. its called Van Der Hagen Deluxe Shave Soap, you can buy a 12 pack set for cheap. i have combination acne prone skin, and this soap is great, doesnt leave me feeling dry afterwards.the proraso cream i brought leaves me dry, this left me more moisturized. and the shave went more smoother
  350. I bought this for the mug, since other mugs were about the same price (or more) than this kit. The mug is heavy with an unobtrusive logo and nice ball handle. Wide mouth makes it easy to whip up a nice lather and the size is standard for soap pucks. Nice upgrade from a coffee mug.<br /><br />The soap makes a nice lather with no overpowering scent. Smooth shaving with a nice clean smell that clears up once you rinse.<br /><br />The brush is pretty good. Not too coarse and the handle is certainly the nicest of the lower dollar brushes. Its not silver badger, but it does the job. Mine took about a week to soften up and stop dropping hair. You'll probably want a better brush if you really get into shaving, but this should be fine until you buy a $70+ one. Overall I think its better than the standard art of shaving brush.<br /><br />The stand works well enough. Its nothing fancy, after all it is just plastic. The base is a bit slippery if you set it on a wet counter but if you have a place where it stays it's fine. It holds the brush securely with no worries of sliding out. It also holds either a double edge razor, straight edge razor or cartridge razor like Fusion or Mach 3 nicely, I would prefer a heavier base for daily use but most of those stands cost twice what this whole kit does.<br /><br />Overall this is a great kit to start with or as a gift. It comes in a nice gift box which is quite sturdy and very well protected with cutout padded dividers for each item. I received this on deployment where my mail got kicked, stepped on, dropped by helicopters and stepped on again! The outside amazon box was toast but the gift box arrived perfect, as did everything inside.

  368. So I got into straight razor shaving a few months ago. I bought this set because I thought it was the quickest and easiest way to get what I needed to get started, and it was.....HOWEVER.... 1) NOT the best soap. It smells nice and lathers well but the lubrication just isn't there. I found myself re-applying soap 4-5 times to the target area to finish the pass and still cutting myself due to lack of lubrication. 2) The bristles on the brush come out easily and are just too long. I couldn't produce a decent lather with the brush without bearing down and dissipating the lather I had already applied. If the brush were trimmed ½ inch or so I'm sure it'd be fine.<br />I use a quality vintage style straight razor (DOVO Bismarck $135) or Spanish style (DOVO Bergischer Lowe $275) razor and neither shaved well with this soap. I tried Col Conk's glycerin soap and it lubricates well though I have Prosaro and Taylor of Old Bond Street soaps on order. The shave is much better with Col Conk's and the SimplyBeautiful 100% Pure Badger Shaving Brush (shorter bristles) with much fewer nicks and irritation.<br />So, basically, you spend $30 for a kit whose only useful components are the stand (only 1 razor) and mug. If I had it to do over, I'd select the pieces separately. $8-$16 for a mug and $16 for a triple stand, $14 for a 3-pack of soap and $12 for a brush. So $50 for a quality set I'd keep instead of $30 for a set I'd throw half of away.<br />This is a decent set if you're giving as a gift, but serious shavers (or serious entry-level enthusiasts) should consider other options.<br />I intend on evaluating the Proraso and Taylor of Old Bond Street soaps when they arrive.

  377. What can I say? I love this set. I'd been going back and forth between cartridge razors and electric shavers for 35(ish) years and was never truly happy with either option. Most recently, I've been using G*** mach 3 razors, and while they work fine for me, they're very expensive.<br />Then I found this set at my local walmart and I thought, what the heck, give it a shot. The safety razor is sold seperately, by the way.<br />The quality of the shave (with a little practice) is as good, or better, than anything else I've ever used. I'm down to the skin with zero stubble every time. And for those of you on a tight schedule for your morning routines, it really doesn't take that much extra time.<br />The shave soap is nice and creamy, and has a nice scent....my wife likes it.<br />The apothecary mug is nice, heavy and solid, and doesn't move around when I make the lather.<br />The brush does shed a bit, but not too bad. The only thing I would change is make the handle on the razor a bit longer, and maybe put rubber grips on it. It can be a bit tough to hang on to, especially when your hands are wet and soapy.<br />And lastly the stand is just ok. Clear acrylic, does the job, looks ok, but not very stylish.<br />All in all, this is a great set.
  378. This is a great starter brush set. The stand actually works a lot better for me than the other people reviewing. Yes it's made from plastic but it's a pretty thick acrylic so it's nice and sturdy. The brush is still shedding after about 7 uses. Before first using it I recommend wetting it down and trying to get as much of it to shed as you can.
  379. This is a great bit pf starter KIT for a shaver. Alas the soap comes in a clear plastic tub and not the metal tin shown in the photo and that was a disappointment (but the soap works as well)... Brush was a surprise as its a great badger for the price too.

  425. I'm new to safety razors and so when I saw this kit I thought I would give it a try since you get just about everything you need. Maybe I'm missing something because the soap smells good until you rub it with the wet hair of the brush and then it seems to smell like wet beaver (the actual animal) which isn't too appealing. I also wasn't able to get what I consider a good lather with this brush/soap combo. Oh well, lesson learned...
  426. The bowl: No chips or obvious flaws, which you often get with cheaper glazed ceramics. The bowl is definitely large enough to fit the shave soap puck and make a good lather on top of it. It is handsome and looks good on the bathroom countertop next to the brush and razor on their stand.<br /><br />The Stand: Has a spot to hang a double edge razor, and also compatible with straight edge razors (there is a dimple in the base to keep the razor from sliding away when leaned in the razor slot. It probably would not work well with cartridge razors (mach 3, etc.) as the slot is quite wide.<br /><br />The soap: probably my favorite part of this set. Mild but pleasent scent, makes a nice thick lather that applies evenly to the face and doesn't run. Lubricates and conditions beard nicely for shaving.<br /><br />The brush: this is the disappointing part of the set. Several bristles come loose each time I use the brush. It has a marked scent of badger, but this disappears after about 10 shaves, and never left a musk smell on me (I could just smell it when I had the wet brush next to me).<br /><br />Bottom line: if you are new to traditional wet shaving, this is a good kit to get you into it. You will probably want to upgrade your brush at some point, but it never hurts to have a spare brush. You can use it for travel to avoid traveling with an expensive brush. Or you can pass it along to a friend to get them into wet shaving.
  427. I bought this for my father as a fathers day gift. I had them gift wrap it and it came in perfect shape, everything seems well made and my dad who had never used a safty Razor loves the set. and says the soap it comes with smells good, the mug is sturdy and not cheeply made. simply put he really likes it since it was a great starter kit.
  428. Wanted to get into straight razor shaving, got this neat little set( razor not included) works like a charm, shave soap smells good last a little while the smell and the soap too.
  429. Review:<br />I've used this for approximately one year now. Yes I've been using the stand, brush and bowl for a year. The soap it comes with is very mediocre, I found that out after mine had run out after a few months (wish my cans of shaving gel lasted that long!). I've had fun since looking around Amazon for different soaps/creams and finding something I will most likely stick with for the rest of my shaving career. The brush is a very nice one, I have a boars brush (boars brushes aren't going to rip your face off) and another badger, apart from STILL shedding this one is my favorite.<br /><br />I decided to ding it because of the soap and the still shedding brush, but I stand by my statement that this is the best box set to buy for when you are getting in to traditional, double-edge blade shaving. Nothing beats having a ceramic bowl, brush and stand for this price. Only way to make this better is by adding a Styptic Pencil.<br /><br />Traditional Shaving:<br />I have been upset with buying cartridge based shavers for years now:<br />- I'm required to shave daily for work, if I shave on Monday and its irritated that usually means by Friday my face is trying to run away from me.<br />- $50 for a set of 10 cartridges that will last me maybe 2 months, the base was $25 alone. Since my purchase I realize the bases are now practically free.<br />- Cans of cream/gel/foam are messy and don't last long.<br />- Shaving took me a long time due to the level of scruff I have under my jaw line. Constantly clogging the cartridge and taking longer then expected to clean out.<br /><br />So I set out to find alternatives to this harsh reality us men have to go through! I came across traditional DE shavers and thought man ... these are still a real thing? AWESOME! I've learned quite a bit on my own in how to shave and that's how I truly believe it should be with everyone. Seeing as everyone has different skin, different hair, different growth they should figure out what works with them and their skin.<br /><br />My recommendation is when you are first taking your baby steps into the magical land of Double Edge Safety Razor shaving, go slow, very slow. Take that razor by the hilt, let it touch your skin without putting pressure on your razor and let it glide slowly down in one small motion and don't go over the area again immediately. Eventually you will figure out how fast you can go, angles to take, pressure applied (I don't apply any!) and if you should go against the grain. Also I find it helpful to change the blade immediately when I feel tugging.<br /><br />Brushes and Lather:<br />Soaps and Creams aren't very different. Creams take less time to make 'thick' lather and often have very strong smells to them. Soaps are tough bars that are usually placed in the bowl with hot water or rubbed in a face cloth to develop lather. Pick your poison, I have both and chose the soap because its A) More fun and B) Doesn't smell like Sex Panther. To develop lather its comically easy; wet brush, stir brush in bowl that has soap in it and apply suds. Personal Preference: As I'm applying lather I would much rather have a 'close' to solid white of foundation versus having the super thick foundation where I won't see my skin.<br /><br />As for the brush, buy a few. If this one isn't cutting it for you there are tons of cheap ones available. I really only bought the other 2 to see what other brushes were like. Found out they are all very similar and why wouldn't they be? I'm not buying a diamond studded brush for $200, all of mine are sub $10 and they did their job without removing my face from my body.<br /><br />Opinion: All the bases are essentially the same. I have a Merkur that transforms into a butterfly so you can let the blade go. I also have a Parker that does the same thing, I find that all I wanted was the easily accessible razor blade. Oh and razor blades, I dislike Merkur Razors. Currently I'm going through a 100 pack of Astra and after that I'm going to try Feather. Right now the Astra's blow away the Merkur's.<br /><br />I'm really happy I have made the move, saved some money, learned something new, got a better shave and I'm having fun shaving now. Its no longer a chore, I like building up my lather, I like that I have to think about shaving my face and plus its great when others find out you don't use a Mach 5 to shave as if you were nuts or grew up in the gritty west! I kept my Mach 3 set, its my backup and travel companion, since I heard they don't like these razors going on planes.
  430. As previously reviewed, the apothecary mug and brush stand are worth the price I paid. The badger hair brush sheds like a long hair cat in Death Valley. The initial smell of the brush was not a problem. It was noticeable, but after a week of shaves, it was totally gone. Think of the brush as a temporary fill-in while you find a quality brush. It will shed into your tub of shaving cream or soap. Have fun getting it out.
  431. Got into wet shaving about a year ago, and got a bunch of stuff for christmas last year, this included. . . honestly it's not worth what you pay for it. Even after shampooing the brush multiple times before using it I still end up with bristles all over my face every time I shave. Also, it slipped out of my hand one time and cracked a large chunk off itself from an 18-inch fall to the bathroom counter. . . The soap smells nice but is nothing special. . . . The mug is sturdy enough that it will stay put on the counter while you lather, which makes the little knob on the side slightly overkill (just my personal opinion here). The stand, however, I have used every day since getting the set. it will hold the brush and any safety razor perfectly. After doing a little research I found that you can make a perfectly good stand out of a coat hanger. . . so wishing I had saved Santa some dough and asked for the cheaper version instead, which is available on here and I have seen at most walmarts for ~10 bucks.
  432. This is the best option for anyone who is considering luxury shaving. I ordered this kit over a year ago to see if it was for me, and still use the shave soap and mug. I have since upgraded to a higher grade brush, but it serves well enough for a beginner to get an idea of what it is all about.

  434. Mug is solid and sturdy, soap smells nice and lasts a good while. The lather that comes from it is good quality and shaves nicely. The brush is better quality than I expected and after months of daily use I have only had a few bristles lost. The brush is soft enough to be used dialy without discomfort but firm enough to generate lather and lift the hairs. Definitely a great buy for a start off kit.

  436. This is a soft badger hair brush with high quality shaving soap in a stylish kit that's going to look very good in your bathroom. The soap lathers and spreads nicely and makes for a positive shaving experience, and having a brush laden with lather allows you to reapply quickly and effectively should you need to touch up any places while you're shaving. I personally use this product with the Merkur long handled safety razor and Merkur razor double edge razor blades. All together they have given me the smoothest and most irritation shave I have ever had.

  441. Good product not much to say about it, I would recommend to a friend!
  442. The brush fell apart within a few months. The bristle component dislodged from the handle and separated in two while I was shaking it to dry the bristles after a shave. I'd like to think Van Der Hagen would happily send me a replacement brush, backing up their product and demonstrating that my experience was a fluke. What is more likely is that the brush is just cheap and you should plan on buying a better brush. Other than that, the set is just dandy. Soap smells great, cup is functional, stand serves its purpose, barely.
  443. I ordered this set, excited to get both a new soap and a decent badger brush. I was very disappointed when I first opened the package and the cloying, synthetic-smelling flowery fragrance made me sneeze. The badger brush is just a &#34;best&#34; and not a silver tip bristle knot, but it looked thick and good for whipping up lather. The mug is heavy and has a little knob for your hand to hold it. The stand is clear acrylic and very sturdy. This set LOOKS great, but the performance leaves much to be desired.<br /><br />ALL badger brushes come from animals that are basically hunted wild in China (with licenses and a only a certain number each year taken in each season) so I expect the hair on the brush to have variation and also a little smell to it. It's usually advised to wash the brush in shaving soap for a bit, then rinse gently and dry it out. But this brush had a horrible animal odor to it that was mixed with a formaldehyde or solvent smell that several washes couldn't get rid of! It was detectable over the scent of the soap (more on that horror in a bit) and lingered in my nostrils after shaving with my favorite soap. Additionally, the brush lost a LOT of hairs (10 to 20) every time I tried to lather with it, rinse it or manipulate it in any way. The knot is not secure enough in the handle and it shows.<br /><br />The soap is another sad story. It's supposedly full of glycerin and oils, but the smell is so overpowering to me that my allergies flared up as soon as I lathered my face. After my shave, I broke out in a rash over the places where the soap was. I respond like that to some synthetic fragrances so I was very disappointed in the soap. It seemed to need a LOT of work to make a good lather, too.<br /><br />This set is a good start but is NOT worth the money. You are better off getting a NICE brush (I have several Edwin Jagger brushes, and they also make Crabtree&Evelyn brushes!) and a GREAT soap like the New Proraso or even a really expensiveshea butter soap bar. Woolfat soaps are also excellent. You'll spend more than this kit, but the brush will last for a LONG time and the soap you like is the soap you use.<br /><br />Try again, Van der Hagen!
  444. This along with some other products has changed shaving for me. The was a great started kit to start the wet double-edge shaving. The only slight complaint is the amount of hair that came from the brush, but it's only the first few time mostly.
  445. When I received the shipment the shave bowl was smashed into smithereens. But Amazon issued a return label and I had a replacement faster than I received the original one. I like the bowl, the handle is easy to grasp and hold with wet or slippery hands and it seems deep enough that nothing slops over the edges. The boar brush seems to get better with time for making lather, faster and easier so I think that's either a matter of break-in, or I'm getting better at knowing how much to soak the brush prior to starting to lather. The soap round that came with it leaves a little to be desired, it seemed to produce a weak lather and now that I've used different ones, I know its the soap and not my technique. I think with time I'll find a better stand as this one is plastic and tips over easily on my counter top with regularity.
  446. Brush is awful. Loses hairs like crazy.

  459. I just started shaving with a safety razor recently and bought this set to accompany my Merkur 180. It was immediately clear to me that this is the way I should be shaving. Not having my hands covered in green sludge from shaving gel is great. The brush feels great against my skin and I don’t end up washing a handful of wasted lather down the drain. The cup is solid and the shaving soap has a very low tone scent. The only issue I have with this set is the stand. Having the brush and razor so close together on the stand makes it a little awkward to grab just one. You have to make sure you grab the brush before the razor and put the razor back before the brush. It is simple clear plastic as well which clashes with the aesthetic of using a safety razor and shaving soap. For the price for a starter set however this can’t be beat so it still gets 5 stars from me. I expect to upgrade the stand but keep the brush, soap, and cup for a long time.
  460. The shaving soap is good, and has a great scent, however the brush tends to shed more than it should and doesn't lather extremely well.
  461. This was a present for a friend. It worked great for a day and then the brush handle broke within two uses.
  462. Dad bought me this as a gift, along with a safety razor. It really is a better way to shave. Once you get used to it, it doesn't take much longer than a modern razor and you get a closer, smoother shave. Leaves your skin in much better condition too.<br /><br />The mug is very nice, it's made of heavy durable glass in a high-gloss black color and has a convenient knob to keep it still while you're making lather.<br /><br />The brush is fantastic, it has a plastic handle in a color to match the mug, I've really abused this thing, I rinse it with scalding hot water and wring it out every day, but none of the hair has come out. It's very soft, absorbent, and is great for lathering up.<br /><br />The soap is very nice when compared to others I've used, creates a very creamy lather, has a pleasant scent, and lasted several months for me.<br /><br />The stand is clear plastic, and holds your brush and razor. I would have liked for the stand to be weighted at the bottom, as I'm afraid of it falling over sometimes. However, it never has fallen over on me, and it serves it's purpose.
  463. Shaving cream is great and so is the razor...the only complaint is that the razor does not always stay in the holder (poor design) aside from that great product.
  464. My husband loves this
  465. The day i received my Van Der. product i was exited to try something new. Spectacular, to say the least. I could not imaging how rich the lather was, the smell from the shave soap was that of greatness. Along with the brush, it felt as if a soft handed angle was coating every inch of my face. The mug was beautifully crafted with its black polished glow. I have no regrets on purchasing this set, never again will i shave with the canned Gels ever again.
  466. Excellent kit. Love the brush and mug. Exactly what I was looking for. The included shaving soap is very nice and leaves a great scent on your skin. The included holder is designed for the brush and other brushes that I have will not work in the holder (it is too wide for their handles). Worth the money. I have been able to find shaving soap refills at my local Fry's/Kroger supermarket.

  472. This set is pretty darn good to start out with the brush is solid and controls easy, the soap smells good and can lather up really well and the cup....well, its a cup, but it's sturdy and heavy.<br />Only a few bad things to say. The brush lost a few hairs upon the first few uses, but never effected its use. The cup has a tendency to let the excess lather spill over the top but that could be user error. The soap smells great but I don't think it is right for me, nothing wrong with it, gives a good shave, just doesn't work for me.<br /><br />Overall: Looking for a great starter kit? You've found it. Complaints about this set will be minor, if any.
  473. Great for beginners.<br /><br />I am new to Safety Razors and needed a starter kit of stand, bowl, brush and soap. This looked like the best, most cost-efficient solution so I gave it a try.<br /><br />First off the Bowl is perfect sized, nicely finished and the Apothecary Style Knob fits well in the hand.<br /><br />The Soap Smells Amazing and does a decent enough job lathering. I originally wanted a Sandalwood or Cedar scent but the Luxury Soap it comes with smells good enough I would strongly consider buying it again.<br /><br />The brush works for a beginner- nothing special, slight odor at first, seems to go away after a few uses.<br /><br />My only qualm is the stand. The brush fits fine, but the razor stand slot is awkward and could have been been designed better.
  474. I bought this set when I decided to give the DE Safety Razor shaving a try. I'm extremely glad I made the switch, and this kit was great at first. Over time I found some things that I didn't quite care about it, but overall it's definitely a good get to get a feel for the whole process.<br /><br />I'll start off with the mug, it's a good weight, the little carrying knob fits in the hand well and helps keep the mug sturdy while lathering up your brush. I do wish it had a cover/lid to it though to keep the soap from drying out. The depth of the mug is great but the narrow bottom does make it a little difficult to get a thicker/fuller brush moving around.<br /><br />The brush is great at first, good weight, thick hairs. After a week the whole hair assembly came out after letting the hairs soak in some steaming hot water, the metal ring is basically held on with an adhesive that had melted from the heat. I got it seated inside the handle again and it has never come out again. What has come out, however, are the hairs. Every...single...shave I end up with a hair or two that comes out either in the bowl or on my face.<br /><br />The soap was great while it lasted, it lathered up great. The scent was a little odd at first but it definitely grew on me. When it was all gone, however, I decided to opt for a higher quality shaving soap.
  475. i have spent years and years and wasted literally thousands of dollars on 2, 3, 4, and even 5 blade razors. After using this starter kit for the past three months I can't imagine ever shaving with those harsh, money-wasting throw-away razors again!<br />At 43 years old, I was more than a little nervous and apprehensive about upending my shaving routine with the shave gel and 'convenient' razors. Seriously, the best decision I ever made and my face has never looked or felt better!! Great as a starter kit or gift set for the gentleman in your life.<br />Specifics: I haven't tried any other products, so I can only provide feedback on this set.<br />Soap: The soap is super easy to use, works up to a creamy lather quickly. This took some getting used to because I was such a 'gel' user. Please, put the gel away! It's drying out your face and is leaving all kinds of chemical residue.<br />Razor: The set doesn't come with a handle. I got a regular length Van Der Hagen handle at a local dept store and I'm happy with the ease of use.<br />Brush: I did a lot of research on brushes and was expecting this one to fall apart rather quickly based on the reviews. However, I've found it to be very reliable and I will continue using it for the foreseeable future. It has lost a few hairs, but doesn't seem impactful.<br />Bowl: I'm still using the original soap and the bowl has been perfect for that. I've already ordered my next soap (Proraso) based on reviews so I'll have to see how this goes.<br />Blades: If I remember correctly, the set comes with five or ten various starter blades. Some were better than others, but I got multiple (2-4) comfortable shaves out of each one. I ordered a box of 100 double edge blades from Personna and I'm very satisfied with their comfort and value.<br /><br />Again, if you are thinking of breaking up with your expensive razors with their vibrations and flex-balls and 18 blades, I strongly suggest you do it NOW and start here! You don't have to break upwith your old stuff, just take a test drive. Your skin and wallet will appreciate it!

  479. This brush feels as though it is really good quality. I haven't had any hair coming out of it yet, the handle is comfortable to hold and use, and the shape of the brush bristles facilitates building a really nice lather.<br /><br />The shaving soap smells good, and builds a great lather... I'll be getting more of it when this runs out.<br /><br />I noticed in many of the reviews that the mug is hard to hold. I think this may be because people are trying to hold it &#34;wrong&#34;... this mug isn't designed to be held by the handle. That handle actually slides between your middle and ring fingers as you wrap your hand around the actual mug itself. That gives you a comfortable and VERY stable grip to the mug while you build lather in it. Best shaving mug I've ever owned.<br /><br />Not too much to say about the stand... it is fully functional but kind of ugly and not the most stable base for your razor. That said it performs it's job well enough to not be replaced. It just seems a little out of place in the greater set.

  485. I wasn't sure I wanted to start using a shaving brush and soap instead of the aerosol cans of shaving cream. I break out easily on my face due to sensitive skin. I am still using this set after a about a year and have had only great results with it. The included soap is easy on my skin, lathers well, and lasts about 3 months for me. The included apothecary mug fits my hand just right. The best part of the set is the brush. I had read that cheaper brushes start to loose their bristles very quickly. This brush has only lost about 4 or 5 bristles that I have been able to see left in the mug. I do think it is very important to rinse your brush and shake out as much water as possible after every use and then hang it on the brush stand.<br /><br />While this isn't a super top of the line shaving set, I think it's the best you can get for someone who has never had a brush and mug set before. There are other scents available to buy separately in this soap line but I haven't tried them. This one has a nice but very light clean scent.
  486. I have looked online everywhere else and Badger brushes can run up to $120. This is a great shaving set and it is very convenient. The soap smells wonderful and will last me for many months

  491. I bought this set because it had several items i I needed to get into wet shaving at a really competitive price. The apothecary mug alone was worth the ~$25 price tag. The mug is glossy and as well made as any mug seems to be. The soap is actually pretty awesome. It's a different product from the cheap VDH pucks available at most drug stores (which also aren't bad). It lathers really well and has a pleasing mild scent. It lathers really well with the supplied brush. That leads me to the brush. The brush is actually a solid beginning product. The black acrylic handle is polished and has had the seams removed. The brush is badger and comes with a slight odor (like all natural hair brushes). The smell dissipates after a few uses. My brush loses a bristle or two each tim, which allows for the brush to last at least a year or two according to other reviews. Overall this is a great entry set with a cool mug, a great soap, and a solid intro brush that will last a couple years or until you experiment and find one you prefer.<br /><br />UPDATE 12/9/2013 After owning this product for about three months the glue holding the knot in the brush handle came loose. The chrome ring, still holding all the bristles in place, just came out of the handle. I guess I'll need to purchase a new shaving brush. While I still think that the kit is a fine place to start, and that the mug and VDH luxury soap puck still make this a fair price, I have to bump the product from five to three stars. I was very disappointed.<br /><br />UPDATE 01/29/14 Originally I said that I really liked the soap, and I do like the smell and the consistency. Unfortunately, it has the slight effect of drawing water away from your face. by the time I get to the last part of my face, I find my skin under the later to be dry and the razor does not glide appropriately. It isn't a severe issue and it doesn't always happen, but since my initial soap puck ran out I have tried both the cheap VDH \\"deluxe\\" soap [[ASIN:B001A3DNY6 Van Der Hagen Deluxe Shave Soap, 2.5-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)]] and Colonel Conk's shave soap [[ASIN:B0071B7XCO Colonel Conk Glycerin Soap - Variety 4 Pack]] and I have found that neither of these products have that effect. Overall I have become pretty disappointed in this starter set. I would recommend you do your research and buy a decent brush and soap and then use a coffee mug.

It holds the brush and my razor well and looks fine on the counter. It's nothing fancy, but it gets the job done.<br /><br />Bowl: The bowl is probably my favorite part of this set. It's ceramic, and just looks sharp on my bathroom counter. It does its job of holding the soap fine, and I like that it has a wide mouth to make it easier to work up a good lather.<br /><br />Soap: The soap leaves my face moisturized, and my wife loves the scent. I'm not sure she'll let me try another brand. After 6 months I'm just starting to see the bottom of the bowl so I'll need to buy a new puck soonish. Definitely beats the can of Gillette I was using.<br /><br />Brush: The brush does a good job of building a lather. It does lose a few bristles with every use, but I haven't noticed a decrease in performance. I expect to have to get a new brush in a year or two, but I never expected it to last forever.<br /><br />Overall, I recommend this to anyone who is looking for an introductory wet shaving set. I expect the bowl and stand to last forever. The brush is decent for the price, and the soap is nice too.

The brush I received shed about 5-6 hairs during my initial break-in, and has been rock solid ever since. One nice factor is the brush has no smell/odor that is common during the break-in of most shaving brushes. The mug and soap provide a nice thick, slick lather, and have a great look as well. All in all this set is a great value for the money spent.

The plastic stand is cheap and the brush slips out of it all the time. Doesn't have any grip. This would be suitable as a first-time set for someone in high school learning to shave. I regret buying it and should have gone with something a bit more high-end.
  543. so far so good impressed nice sent on soap
  544. A great shave set. Really love the badger hair brush, works so much better than the boar bristle I was using. The stand is a nice tough as well. Great job Van Der Hagen !!<br /><br />Scott L.<br />South Bend, IN
  545. If you're a wet shave connoisseur, as are apparently many of the other reviewers of this product, then there is probably nothing of value I could tell you about this shave set. You probably have your own ideas about what's best, anyway. Shopping for shaving products online has been a hoot, reading all about how people consider scraping a metal blade across your face to be a &#34;lost art.&#34; What are we, princesses? Anyhoo, I'll write my review for &#34;the rest of us.&#34;<br /><br />I bought this because I was looking to get as much stuff in a single package as possible, at the lowest price. I researched online for several days and ultimately decided that this one was the best value. I think that much is undeniable.<br /><br />The brush, mug, and soap are all fine. I would not describe them as amazing, I would simply say that they do an adequate job, and considering that we are talking about bathroom products, what more do you want? What are we, princesses?<br /><br />The plastic stand that holds the brush - and a razor, although the packaging does not specify this - is the weak link here. It holds the brush perfectly, but the razor slides in behind the brush and has a tendency to slide back off the stand. It was obviously designed to save space, which could be a benefit, but for me, it tends to be a mild inconvenience to try to get at my razor every morning. But then again, what are we, princesses?
  546. Recently converted to using a safety razor for shaving. On recommendations from coworkers, I decided to try using shave soap instead of the normal shaving cream in a can. Found this set for a very reasonable price ($10 less than my local Walgreen's) and thought it would be a good introductory set. It is just that; a perfect introductory set. The apothecary mug is nice, and some mugs cost just as much as this whole set. The stand included is nothing fancy, but it gets the job done, and fits both the brush and my Microtouch one safety razor very well. The shave soap is great and doesn't have an overpowering smell. The brush is all badger hair, which my research tells me is the only way to go. The brush handle is plastic, but still looks good (doesn't look cheap). Brushes can cost upwards of $100+, and I've read that if you are going to spend money on anything, you should invest more in the brush. My only concerns with this brush is with the quality of the glue holding the bristles to the handle. I just don't know how long it will hold up. Only time will tell. So far so good.
  547. I bought this as an open box item. It came sooner than it was quoted as when it would arrive . There was nothing wrong with the item the box was wrinkled on one corner. Big deal. great item.
  548. Got this one for my boyfriend for Christmas and it was a huge hit. He enjoys shaving with it, the only things that could be improved would be a nicer container for the cream (my boyfriend tipped it out into a little pyrex dish which looks a lot better) and the depth of the mug, which makes it difficult to work up a lather without getting it all over the brush handle and your hands.<br /><br />But on the whole a good product at a good price.
  549. Very smooth shave and good design. I had my doubts about the soap, but it has won me over. The only issue I have with it is the smell of the brush. It's...gamey? I would say... I guess it's the smell of badger. If I got the chance to change anything, it'd be getting a synthetic brush.
  550. bought this set about a year ago. haven't replaced a thing. nice quality double edged razor and mug. the only thing I've considered replacing is the stand. Its plastic and easy to knock over.
  551. This is a nice starting kit for any beginner. The mug is solid and heavy, I leave it in the sink full of hot water to stay warm. The brush is not the best. It sheds often, and on my very first use the epoxy holding the knot in came right off... maybe my sink is just hotter than yours. The plastic holder is fine. I purchased as a first timer knowing I would upgrade relatively soon anyways, so it was worth the price to see if DE shaving was for me (IT IS).

  554. I had pre-ordered this set just for fun and to satisfy a shaving brush aquisition disorder along with a shave soap aquisition disorder. I wish I had owned something like this when I first started wet shaving. It was shipped on Thursday the 24th of March. I received it the next day the 25th and shaved with it on the 26th. I am very pleased with this set. You could own only this set and not need any other soap or brush. The brush is pure badger and is a great brush. Soap is an improved one over the Deluxe (which is also a good soap for the money). It lathers great and is slick and protective for the blade. The scent is faintly reminiscent of cucumber. The apothocary mug is easy to use. Style wise is goes hand in hand with the brush. Both being a shiny black. And the stand for the brush is a thick heavy plastic which also has a slot for your razor. I'm liking this a lot. It is well worth the price of the product. If you're just starting out wet shaving, this is a great way to start. If you're an old pro, then this something worth adding to your collection.
  555. Great set...The first shave set that I owned was the old Van Der Hagen Shave set that was good for the beginner. Since then I have purchased the Art of Shaving Sandalwood set with the badger brush (great, but $100). I wish this new Van Der Hagen set would have came out sooner, I would have saved $100. The brush from TAOS is great but I LOVE the one from this set..Perfect height and weight..REAL BADGER HAIR..I know because I forgot to wash the brush with shampoo prior to the first use and it smelled like a wet dog...REMEMBER TO SHAMPOO BRUSH BEFORE USE...The mug I love as well..Perfectly designed...I have not tried the soap as of yet since I wanted to try the brush with my Proraso cream but it smells great...The stand is nice, not all that..Does what it is supposed to, hold a brush and a razor..Nothing to display and show off..It looks like it was a single piece of acrylic that was melted and formed into shape..Nothing to write home about but great add on...Over all if you are into wet shaving or know someone who is, BUY THIS SET if they do not all ready have it..

  570. Lots of questions and coments have been going around this product.<br />1) The bowl: This is why I got this. I needed a low cost bowl for my existing soap. This bowl is a good design. short enough to use (anyone using a coffe cup knows that digging in deep when soap is almost gone is hard to lather up without clinking the sides a lot), fit a standard size cake of soap very well as. So the bowl gets an A+!<br /><br />2) The brush: I have only used it one time so far, but I am impressed. Nice quality look and feel and only one lost hair. Not bad sheeding as is normally expected. Too early to give a full endorsement, but early signs are a solid A.<br /><br />3) The soap: OK its a personal preference but I think it smells nice. But I have not used it as I am not done with my current cake. Soap is cheap and a matter of choice. I'm not grading this.<br /><br />4) The stand: This is ok for the brush to stand in. Of course you can just set the brush on its base facing up as I have done for years anyway. Some folks say it is tippy. If you only have the brush in it it seems to work fine. The razor part is another story. If you use a &#34;normal&#34; razor with disposable blades like a Mach 3 or whatever it works ok. I put one in there to check it. but if you use a short handled double sided safety razor, this stand is quite poor. I give the stand a C as a brush only stand and F as a combo razor / brush stand<br /><br />All in all for the small price, I can not complain. The item I bought this for gets an A+. I am pleased with teh brush as well (bonus i my mind) The soap is fine too. Only the stand is dud. But this is is very low cost buy it for you need and if you really want it for the stand, look at another kit.

  579. I thought getting back into &#34;luxury shaving&#34; this would be a great starting set. Well, the stand is the only thing I'm still using a few weeks into it. The mug I very well may use in the near future. Basically, the mug, stand and brush are all made in china. The mug is basically the same you can get for around $15 and up with different names on it. The stand is nothing fancy and does the job of holding the brush and razor (mine is a Merkur 180). The brush is poorly constructed, however the badger hairs are soft. The soap is glycerine based and not much better than bar soap. Basically, I now use an Omega Boar Brush, Cella or Proraso soap and still use this stand. Again, it's not a bad product, but if I did it again, I'd basically buy a better stand, a brush and use a better soap product and not worry about this set or a mug in general.

But what you receive is &#34;you get what you pay for,&#34; meaning it's crap. The clear plastic brush stand is heavy duty but just another thing to clutter the bathroom counter.... so for me it's not needed. The soap lathers well, smells nice without being overbearing and seems to have glycerin for your skin. Now the brush...... cheap, brush irritates the skin and stinks right out of the box. First time using, the brush came out of the handle... plop into the sink. I've tried notifying the company with never a response for a replacement, comment, etc. It's all made in China. Which is not a bad thing, but some things made there or anywhere is CRAP and this is CRAP. With the time, hassle, and cost to ship it back for a refund you'll be loosing more money and the &#34;Van Der Hagen&#34; company must know that. Just good marketing starting with the fancy name. Though tempted don't buy, you're wasting $$. Wet shaving is good but go elsewhere for products.
  599. Great shave shoap, makes a nice smelling, rich lather. The badger brush is the lowest tier of badger (pure badger), but nonetheless is soft and good at charging up soap and creating a nice lather against your face, in a mug, or even the palm of your hand. The brush itself could be better constructed as it has lost quite a few hairs and this is happening after several weeks of ownership and use. Thankfully, this brush does not deform from use, at leats not yet, and retains its fluffy, soft nature. I haven't had a problem with the brush head falling off, but I do agree it feels cheap (knot is glued to a cheap, plastic handle). The bulldog mug it comes with is nice and comfortable in the hand and the stand looks good on almost any bathroom countertop (Will fit most safety razors or even regular cartridge razors, not meant for a straight razor). Overall it's a good starter kit for anyone curious about delving into the world of safety razor shaving and using shave soap/creams.

It really feels like you're a MAN, the way men used to be the way...our fathers and grandfathers would.   610. I just wanted to make sure everyone was aware that the brush included in this kit is complete garbage. The boar brush in the 10$ soap,mug,brush combo by Van Der Hagen has the same quality of hair as the brush in this kit. I purchased this kit thinking that it came with the same brush as the Van Der Hagen Men's Luxury, Badger Brush IT IS NOT THE SAME BRUSH!<br /><br />Just to make it clear the Van Der Hagen Men's Luxury, Badger Brush that is sold as a separate item is a vastly superior brush in terms of the badger hair. The brush included in this kit is NIGHT AND DAY DIFFERENT and would be a good way to rub your skin raw. The hair doesn't even look the same.<br /><br />With all of that said, the soap and mug included in this set appear to be of good quality. The plastic stand was bigger and heavier than i was expecting an that was a pleasant suprise, however i was a little disappointed that the plastic stand was scratched up inside of the undamaged box. If you are buying this kit only for the mug soap and stand this could be a good deal for you, assuming you take the brush as a loss.<br /><br />If you are a new wet shaver i would recommend that you buy an actual brush rather than this kit.
  611. Great shave mug, okay stand and good badger brush. I'ved owned a boar brush and I must say that the badger is a great upgrade. Some say that they would like the brush to weigh more because it floats, but I don't mind it at all. The soap lathers okay but doesn't compare to a cream. Has a great smell though and leaves your skin nice and soft. Doesn't overdry. Can't go wrong for the price. Excellent beginners set! Would recommend.
  612. Nice set. Brush is sturdy and creates/holds a nice lather. Plastic stand is a little boring but does the job. Make sure to keep brush held in upside down position when not using. Will extend life. Mug is nice. Very solid. Good handle. Soap is okay. Makes a nice lather and smells nice. If you are a serious straight razor shaver, I recommend the DREADNOUGHT products. As a whole, this is a nice set.
  613. I bought this to replace my last brush, but now wish I hadnt. If you have a place on the counter you can keep it at all times, it's probably a non-issue.<br /><br />The pros: The mug was much bigger than I thought it was going to be, at first I thought wow this is huge, too big even. But after using it I realized it's just right and their soap bar fits it perfectly. The brush, aside from poor gluing, is a nice full head of hair, not a dinky thing that many cheap brushes are. It may not be top quality and very stimulating to the face, but it lathers on the soap good. Oh and the brush and mug do look nice and presentable.<br /><br />I was about to rate it 3 or 4 stars, until I took the price into account.<br />Based on what you get for only $25, I have to say I am overall pleased and would probably buy it again if I had to do it over.
  619. I learned to shave with a safety razor some 30+ years ago, but have been using the cartridge razors since. The prices on these are getting outrageous, so I've decide to go &#34;old school&#34;, and started with this when my shaving gel ran out. Took some practice to get just the right amount of water so it will lather up just right, and now that i have that figured out, I LOVE this! The shave is just as good as the fancy shaving gel I was using (I won't name names), but I get less irritation on my skin with this soap. As soon as my cartridges run out, I'll be switching over to a safety razor for good, too (have one ready to go, and tried it a couple times - LOVE IT!).<br /><br />I will admit, though, that I did not buy it on Amazon.   625. If you are interested in embarking on the incredible journey of classic shaving, I would say this is a great place to start. Van Der Hagen has produced an excellent product here, especially for the price. I wouldn't consider myself to be any sort of classic shaving veteran by any means; however, I am most definitely well accustomed to this class of shaving. Is there better/higher quality products out there? Yes of course there is, but not in this price range. The brush offers a comfortable handle for building your lather, and holds water quite well too. The mug is a perfect fit for the puck that is included with this package. The mug has a nice quality feel to it and is quite comfortable in the hands as well. As for the soap, It has a fantastic fresh sent to it that is not to powerful like others I have used. It seems to to a fair job and building up a decent lather too! Last but certainly not least, the stand. A stand for your shaving set is absolutely essential for proper care of your equipment. It may not be the most appealing stand on the market, but hey it gets the job done!
  626. Its a great kit for $25. Mug: the mug holds water, fear not, the water is held by the mug. :) Soap: I was pleasantly surprised by the soap, i was expecting a cheap, motel hand soap scent and a crappy lather from it and thats not what i got. The scent is very enjoyable almost cologne-ish. The lather also worked well for me and lasted through my shave without any nicks. Stand: the stand holds my brush and my razor in a haphazardly fashion. The razor has to be in a specific angle or it won't stay on the holder or there isn't room for a brush (minus 1 star.) Brush: the brush has actually been working really well for me, its stiff enough to get a good lather/exfoliation but still soft. Again the kit was $25 (at time of purchase) so if you're starting out or testing a potential hobby give it a go, just order a different stand. Cheers!

  644. I'm giving this 4 stars, but I would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting to make the switch to shave soaps and a badger brush. I purchased this at a Walgreen's, and Amazon is a little less expensive. You can get more expensive starter kits, but this one is perfect, especially if you're just trying to test this method.<br /><br />For reference, I have extremely sensitive skin, and am prone to razor bumps, even with a brand new razor, and sensitive-skin shave gel, with a lot of skin prep. So keep that in ind while reading. Here's my rating in order of precedence.<br /><br />o The SOAP gets 5 stars -- The soap has a very pleasant scent, and even though it has cocoa butter in it, I can't smell it (which is a plus for me). The soap lathers really well, is very slick, and I actually got no nicks on my first shave. It rinses very clean, and left me with a feeling on my skin that I usually get after using a toner.<br /><br />o The BRUSH gets 4 stars -- The Brush did shed a little bit, which may be normal, but it did bother me a little bit. Also, the bristles are very soft, which make it difficult to work an extremely thick lather. However, it did allow me to work a lather that was very slick and protected my face; I just usually prefer heavier. The scent of the badger brush isn't overly powerful, and I'm sure it will wash out in a couple weeks (I shave daily). Does the job, and is an attractive handle.<br /><br />o The STAND gets 4 Stars -- There's no channeling on the stand for water runoff, which is the main reason (NOT A DEAL BREAKER). Standing water breeds bacteria, so I didn't like that. It cleans very easily though, and holds my triple blade razor just fine.<br /><br />o The BOWL gets 5 Stars -- This bowl is large enough to accommodate other soaps, and not run over with lather. The handle isn't entirely ergonomic, but that's not a big deal. The porcelain finish is very smooth, and it looks great.<br /><br />o Not that you need to make a fashionstatement while shaving, but this kit looks great, and is just as functional. I haven't had it long, but I'm very impressed. I've been using this with a 4 bladed razor, and it's great. I plan on purchasing a safety razor once I'm out of cartridges, so I'll update my review then.<br /><br />Thanks for reading, I hope this was helpful

The bowl is pretty nice, I wish it were a bit smaller on the bottom to hold in place the cheap Van Der Hagen shave soaps that you can buy, but as it stands it's a great bowl, easily worth $8-12. The stand is simple, and looks good sitting next to almost any sink. Probably worth $5-8. The soap is larger, smells nice, and lathers really well, probably worth $3. You add everything up, and you realize this set is probably one of the better deals on Amazon. It's EASILY worth its $28 asking price, and a great way to introduce yourself to the art of wet shaving.   675. I began my switch to DE shaving using the [[ASIN:B001A3HPT0 Van Der Hagen Premium Shave Set (Soap, Bowl, Brush)]]. That kit is actually pretty usable, and I had no issue with the plastic-handled boar bristle brush. However, it doesn't come with a stand. If you look around, the only stands you'll find are either expensive, not made well enough to stand up to water exposure (cracking of wood, peeling of metal plating), or hold only a brush.<br /><br />I bought this one at the same price as a plastic stand elsewhere, but THIS one's stand comfortably holds the included brush AND my razor. Since it's plastic, it won't rust or crack from exposure to water. It looks good on the counter. Awesome.<br /><br />It also comes with a badger brush, instead of the boar brush that comes with the cheaper kit. The \\"off\\" smell of the badger brush faded within three days or so, and the initial shedding of bristles was done within a week. The brush is nice and soft, although, to be honest, I might slightly prefer the stiffer boar bristles for spreading shaving cream. (Note that the slot for the brush on the stand included in this kit is a bit snug for the cheaper kit's brush. A bit of sanding might be in order to enlarge the cutout a bit, if you wanted to do that.)<br /><br />It also comes with a mug for shaving soap. A HUGE, OVERSIZED mug. I donated that to the thrift store, in favor of a smaller repurposed coffee cup that matches my bathroom and isn't ginormous.<br /><br />Finally, it comes with shaving soap. It's white, and really heavily scented. It also doesn't lubricate as well as the inexpensive [[ASIN:B001A3DNY6 Van Der Hagen Deluxe Shave Soap]] that comes in the cheaper kit. I tossed the soap with this kit after 10 days (and several razor burns), and all is well after going back to the cheap kit's soap.<br /><br />In the end, I'm quite happy I bought this, if only for the stand and brush, so even if the other items aren't to your liking (as they weren't to mine), you're coming out ahead.
  676. The price on this set is a huge value. I've seen the cup for more than this set. Shaving brushes can go above $100. I have had this a bit over a few months. This review has been edited on April 11,2015. To shave with this you can't hurry . My best results have been doing these steps. Microwave a coffee cup of water for 2.5 minutes. Pour a small amount on top of the soap and cup, place brush in the cup of water. Let it set for 5 or more minutes.Water should be absorbed by the soap.Shake out the brush and work up the lather. This will take at least 2 minutes. brush your face in circles to get good lather on your face. I have squeezed lather out of the brush to get the thickest lather to my face. The lather/soap has a very clean nice smell and the lather is thicker and less airy than the cans.Some soaps cost more than this whole kit.I read other more costly palm oil based soaps may last a year and have better lather. There is a lot of shaving with a brush videos & tips on you tube.
  677. I got this as a gift for my boyfriend. It came fast and it is an accurate description
  678. Brush broke off the handle on the first use! Kind of a bummer but I didnt buy this kit for the brush anyway. I already have a nice badger brush. Will try to hot glue it back in place. Mug is a little narrow at the base but looks nice. Stand is functional. Havent tried the soap yet.
  679. First experience with shave soap and brush. It adds an extra minute to morning routine but it smells good and the whole kit looks nicer on the sink than a metal can of shaving cream that leaves behind rust marks.<br /><br />After six weeks of use shaving 4-5 times a week I'll admit that the brush bristles seem to be falling out more often than I would like. I will probably be getting a better quality brush soon anyway. the shave mug is very nice and is probably the best part of the kit. The soap is okay and it lathers up pretty nicely but there are better options out there. The stand is decent but not real stable.   705. I've been wet shaving (badger brush and soap) for over 7 years now. I have over a dozen badger brushes and have tried so many shave soaps I've lost count. This kit from Van Der Hagen is the most exceptional value I have found.<br /><br />The brush, while not super soft like a high end brush, is a perfectly serviceable brush. It's a little scatchy on your face but not uncomfortable.<br /><br />The soap is fantastic. Paired with the brush you can create a rich, creamy, wet, slick lather - perfect for shaving. The soap is very moisturizing it won't leave your skin feeling dried out like many shave soaps. Instead, my face feels soft and smooth.<br /><br />The included mug and brush stand are a great addition. I'm stunned that such a great kit is available at such a low price. I would recommend this kit for all would-be wet shavers and even those veterans that own several brushes and soaps like I do. Worth every penny.<br /><br />My only piece of advice is to wash the brush well before your first use. Wet the brush and use some hair shampoo and work up a good lather to rinse out the residue from manufacturing the brush. The brush will shed a few hairs after each use but this will subside over a few days use.
  706. Arrived very fast and very promptly! Great little kit other than I would redesign the razor holder as a whole rather than a slot, other wise overall a great product.

  708. This purchase was my first foray into shaving with a brush and shave soap. Been for about two month now and I'm very happy. The manufacturer should redesign that part of the stand so a razor sits at a more acute angle to prevent this.

  711. I've had this kit for a bit now and I LOVE it. Soap smells great and works very well, way better than any big name stuff from a can. It's very gentile on your skin and does a great job letting the razor glide across your face (I have the Merkur Futur D/E).<br /><br />The stand works very well and fits my razor on it perfectly. The mug is heavy and looks really nice. easy to just leave it on the counter and build a lather with the brush.<br /><br />The Brush is good (excellent at this price). I have not had any issue with shedding from my brush. I took the time to read the instructions and get tips from online before I used anything and I think that's part of the reason I don't have any issue. Silver Tip Badger brushes are softer and feel better on your face, but the brush alone can be 3x-6x the price of this whole kit so let's keep things in perspective...<br /><br />You can't and should not use a lot of pressure on the brush when building a lather or applying the lather to your face. I rinse the brush well and shake off excess water, put it right on the stand and let it fully dry.<br /><br />The first time I used the brush I had about 4 hairs shed (expected from a brand new brush). Since then, maybe 6-7 more hairs total have shed from the brush.<br /><br />Take care of this set and it will take care of you. This is a great set to get you started with out a lot of money down.<br /><br />Update: 10-1-13<br /><br />Still Zero issue from this set. I've used up the soap and moved to a Taylor of Old Bond Street cream that is very nice. not THAT much better than the soap that came with this set, but it does moisturize my skin better and is nice enough to be worth the extra few $$ to me. Brush is still working great with still nearly zero shedding...<br /><br />Once again, this is a great set to start off with and expand upon.

The stand also has a place for my razor, and though basic, works great. As I remember the soap was quite acceptable as well, though I now use Proraso as my daily choice.<br /><br />I've dropped the mug, more than once, and it's still in one piece, so it's pretty sturdy. And the set goes with me for overnight trips as well, and still looks like new.<br /><br />The Van Der Hagen brush is a real workhorse and, other than losing an occasional hair, is still going strong. It's actually quite generous in size, in case you are wondering. I have a Tweezerman brush, which is smaller and more compact. The Van Der Hagen brush is both longer and fuller and has a great feel on your face.<br /><br />I thought I would quickly discard the stand, but it's very handy. Holding both the brush and my razor, it makes the perfect overnight setup. And, being acrylic, its surpisingly tough and very easy to keep clean.<br /><br />If you are new to shaving, or just looking for a nice daily setup, I'd recommend the Van Der Hagen Men's Luxury Shave Set without any reservations. As well as all the other positives, the mug and brush have the classic appearance of a much more expensive set.

  740. I bought this set for my husband, who just started doing traditional shaving a few weeks before I bought it and wanted a set. It was part of a larger Valentine's Day gift.<br /><br />This works very well for him. He says he didn't like the soap because it dried out the skin on his face, so he doesn't really use the soap. He sometimes uses a solid soap, but usually uses a gel shave cream like Gillette. I know, defeating the purpose, but it works for him - he says using the brush helps raise the hairs to get a closer shave and he likes having the dish to lather up the cream/gel with. The stand is the perfect size to hold the brush and his Gillette ProGlide razors. If you brush against the stand lightly, the razor will fall out - a bit annoying because we have a small sink, but most of the time it's not a problem. The dish is really sturdy.

Although made in China (except the vegetable-based soap), all of it appears to be very high quality. The clear, plastic stand is rather spartan, but serves the purpose for what it was intended. The brush is soft and has good 'skin feel'. Unlike some inferior quality brushes, this one does not lose a lot of hairs. The soap has a clean, almost neutral smell. Seems almost like a 'fragrance free' type of shave soap, but not quite. Doesn't seem to lather up as much as others I've tried, but still good. All in all, a great value!

The glycerin based soaps seem to be better for my skin, and the brush just feels luxurious and stimulating. Sometimes I don't even shave, I just use the brush to wash my face.   752. This set is a very high value, covers all bases set for anyone who is interested in DE razor or straight razor shaving. As I was looking into getting a DE safety razor, I was looking around for a brush. Money is tight, so I figured I could just find a bowl somewhere and get some soap at the grocery store or something. However, I realized I did need a brush, and that I did need a stand for the brush. After looking around for the best badger brush I could get for under 30 dollars, I came across this set. I was like, &#34;Wow, a decent looking badger brush AND a stand!!&#34; (other stands are usually like 20 dollars themselves!). I figured the mug and soap were just nifty little extras. But man I underestimated this set. The mug is really cool, the stand holds your razor and the brush (which by itself is very decent considering the cost. It could be a little softer, but I'm satisfied with it until I wear it out, which I don't expect to happen anytime soon). Just look at the set up in the pictures. Drop the soap in the mug, and you're set! It took some practice to get the lather right. What you need to do is soak your brush for a minute, then shake half the water out, and just start whipping. Keep going and going and going, longer than you think you should at first, and you will have a VERY high quality and functioning lather. Even if you don't want to go old fashioned with the razor, use this set with your fusion or whatever you use, it will shave like a dream (also fantastic gift set).
  753. This was my first shaving brush and mug purchase. I had been looking to get into traditional shaving. I read the reviews on this set and made my purchase based on that. I have been completely satisfied so far. I've used the brush with three different creams: Bigelow, Musco Real, and Art of Shaving The brush lathers extremely well and I have only been hand lathering. The mug works well and is the perfect size. The clear brush stand is a nice compliment to the set as well. Very satisfied so far and great deal for the money.

  757. Honestly, wet shaving is the only way to shave. I suffer from sensitive skin, so the razors from the store really did a number on my face. My only saving grace were disposable ones (rec. to me by my doctor) since they were sharp. I ventured into wet shaving since I heard it was the best way to go. WOW. No more ingrown hairs, red marks, white heads, etc., I bought a cheaper starter set at a local drug store and the brush fell apart. Then I bought this. The soap is nice, the stand works and the mug--is fantastic! Will this be the last set you ever own? Of course not. But will it work to test the waters? You bet. Honestly, the only thing I see having to \\"upgrade\\" over time is the brush. The mug is very well made and the stand, well it's plastic, but it doesn't do much but hold your razor/brush. Also, to combat razor burn, ingrown hairs, use alcoholic aftershave (yes, I know people will tell you it dries out your skin, but your grandpa used it his whole life and his face didn't fall off). I love this [[ASIN:B000053L6Y Clubman Pinaud After Shave Lotion, 6-Ounce]] most.
